Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: samh66
Reviews.Content: Having spent some considerable time trying to work out the best place to stay for our two nights in Singapore we chose the Sheraton Towers, Scotts Roade. I was a little worried it might be a bit far from everything but the location was perfect. We were able to walk to everywhere we wanted to go which included Orchard Road right to the far end where we went on the Singapore flyer and visited Raffles. It took a couple of hours but that was stopping looking in the shops along the way. When booking the hotel we asked for two connecting rooms, poolside and that was exactly what we got. The room had a 6ft bed, lovely bathroom, mini bar, bathrobes, Slippers. The rooms have adaptors which will take all types of plugs, even out British 3 pin. Saves all those adaptors!, All the things that you would expect from a Sheraton. When you walked out of the sliding patio doors it was directly on the poolside. Couldn't have been better. The hotel has a dining room which also offers breakfast but we didn't use this. There is also a bar/lounge area offering afternoon tea as well as the usual selection of bar drinks in the evening. Just a short walk from the hotel is the Newton Food Court which is an experience. You will be badgered as soon as you walk in but have a walk arond and choose which of the stalls you want to eat from then sit down and order. The seafood is to die for and full of locals which I believe is a good sign!! The hotel are happy to book any excursions for you. We did the night safari which was certainly worth the money. Beware if asking the hotel to book a taxi for you. They charge 8 Singapore dollars just to make the call which is a little bit on the steep side. i would recommend that you book the driver that drops you from the airport for your return. The Internet is also very expensive and there is no WIFI available in the lobby areas. You can use a PC in the conference area but its not exactly convenient. You would expect hotels in this class to at least have WIFI in common areas. Overall these hotel was ideal for our short stay in Singapore and I would certainly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but very loud noise”
Reviews.Author: islandbikini
Reviews.Content: Let me start with the positive things about this hotel. 1. Great location. So easy to walk anywhere in the city. To get taxi to the river is not that expensive either but remember Singapore is so small therefore it is easy to travel around the whole island. 2. The staff were polite and helpful Cons 1. Very lous construction next door. You will not be able to relax unless you stay on the other corner of the hotel. 2. The breakfast buffet offeres variety of dishes but they had been sitting there for too long that they were not fresh. I had a stomach problem right away. 3. It is a big property but seems like they're always crowded everywhere. Would recommend if you stay for few nights for business trip but not good for couple or family.

Reviews.Title: “Accomodations as Expected - Service that Excelled”
Reviews.Author: Lienmailliw
Reviews.Content: We spent several days here as a base while waiting to join our cruise. Our luggage was lost by our airlines and we were very stressed about that - being worried about having nothing to wear on the cruise. We found the hotel's service to be excellent, especially the assistance of the concierge, Xavier, who stayed in contact with the airline and the airport chasing our luggage on our behalf and allowing us to enjoy a bit of a vacation in Singapore rather than spending all of our time chasing our lost luggage. His helpful attitude and assistance reduced the stress and worry caused by the loss of our luggage. The hotel is not Raffles, nor is it the Marina Sands, but it met every expectation we had. The bed was very comfortable, the bathroom very nice and spacious, the shower rainhead very refreshing and the room large, clean and comfortable. The hotel is about a 10 min walk from the shopping on Orchard and I enjoyed every bit of it - walking past several colonial homes on Scott which you wouldn't see otherwise. The service made this hotel an excellent experience. It is nice when things proceed flawlessly, but I believe you really see a hotel's service ethic when they are presented with issues to overcome. This hotel performed excellently, recovering from a check in glitch and stepping up on the lost luggage issue.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Sheraton but the service and staff were excellent.”
Reviews.Author: phxexplorer
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in the Sheraton Towers Singapore and we enjoyed it very much. The rooms, or at least ours, was a typical Sheraton room. It was very a comfortable, clean room and the bed was very comfortable. Our room included breakfast and it was also excellent. The lobby is very spacious and looks out on a water fall feature that is also very attractive. I certainly recommend the hotel as a convenient, comfortable place to stay in Singapore. We thought that the staff was excellent, we particularly enjoyed the doorman who had a sparkling sense of humor and always welcomed us back as if we were family.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated”
Reviews.Author: Ajmba06
Reviews.Content: This is slightly overpriced for what it has to offer. The location is excellent, quite close to orchard road, but definitely cannot walk, if you have a full day of shopping planned. We chose to live there with exactly that in mind. (shop till the wife drops!) The hotel building though they say is refurbished, still looks run down and dated. The service is good and there is nothing to complain. It could pass off as a decent business hotel, but for a city like Singapore where there is no dearth of choice,they need to up the ante.

Reviews.Title: “Tired but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Duncan M
Reviews.Content: SPG points and a bit of cash made this a tempting dealing in the expensive Singapore market. For a fast overnight I wanted something comfortable and the bed and linen were very good, as was dinner at Domus. Staff were very pleasant throughout though in the Lobby Bar they could do with a bit of training - a gin martini arrived as a watery gin and tonic, and staff were chatting at the bar rather than working the floor. Rooms are comfortable but quite tired. The TV was a museum piece, and power was provided to the work area via power board that skated around on the floor -not quite 5 star. Bathroom was OK but the bath/shower area was very tired and a bit spotty. The hotel is well maintained but is in need of a major refurbishment sooner rather than later.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: marc_martin
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in Singapore and chose this hotel due to its good location near Orchard Road and MRT station. The corner room we had was renovated and nicely decorated. The service was superb and the food way above average. We would definitely go back in the near future when visiting Singapore again. The only bad thing was that we had to pay a rather high amount of SGD 30.00 for a 24 hour WiFi access.

Reviews.Title: “Choose only if business is next door”
Reviews.Author: AlamTravel
Reviews.Content: Read this with a major 'reference' point vs. other hotels in Singapore as for Europeans and Americans, this property is rather above average in many ways. But for Singapore, this is a 3-star hotel at best in every respect. Location: Isolated in terms of walking down to the lobby level and finding stores. Not isolated if you think of a subway station 30 seconds away and Orchard Road a nice 10-15 min walk. But seriously, this is the most isolated hotel I have stayed at. It is in a residential area, quiet, uneventful. Price: For the price you would pay at this place, go to the Marina or Orchard Road. There is absolutely nothing to justify the price compared with other hotels. None. Nada. Zilch. Not in quality. Not in service. Not in amenities. Not in flexibility of the staff. Rooms: I got assigned a non-refurbished one. Really old style. The TV is a 19 inch CRT. It was nice seeing 15-year old technology. The remote control must have bacteria from the 19th century ( you will note in other hotels the remote controls are wrapped in plastic and the plastic is sanitized regularly ). The lighting system is frustrating: you must control all lights from a control board by the bed. If it is dark, you are out of luck in terms of what to turn on. The bed is ok. The desk chair had major stains but was replaced promptly. The safe can not hold large laptops so be forewarned. It is on the small side but at least available. The laundry prices are super expensive. They are a rip off, i.e. 5 SGD for socks. There is a fridge that is not automated so that's a plus as you can use it with your own drinks. The room itself has plenty of space, not tiny by any measure. What started off my stay on the wrong footing was the manager on duty rather using a white lie when I asked him why I was not given a newer room. His answer: well sir, given you are staying here for 5 nights, It is better for you to avoid the smell from the new rooms; I put only people for 1-2 nights in those rooms because of the smell. :) Imaginative but a lie. I asked him to extend my stay by one night at check in. His answer: well sir, given you booked on expedia, it is better you go back to expedia. In short, one of the worst managers I have encountered in Singapore. No interest whatsoever in making me feel welcome. The gym: bad circulation of air so that sweaty smell when you are exercising. Too few machines for cardio given the hotel size: 4 treadmills and 2 steppers and 1 rower and 1 bicycle. They would need double that. Even at 6:30 AM you can't find a treadmill. The pool: I did not use but looks nice and clean. Breakfast: Frankly, below average ( for Singapore again ). For a European hotel, it is 5 star breakfast. For Singapore, it is a 2 start breakfast. Limited choice. No service by waiters. Overall, I would highly greatly immensely recommend you stay elsewhere as the Sheraton does not have a major price difference with other properties. I would not recommend nor would I come back here. If you pay for an executive room with lounge access, go somewhere else as you will have paid the price of a much better hotel and do not have to play roulette about getting a room from the 70s. Internet is 21 SGD a night for one device and 28 for 2 devices. I hope this is helpful. There is absolutely no view from this hotel other than dull suburbia.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jono B
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel but nothing amazing either... its a little out of the way and seemed very quiet at all times. The pool was freezing as the sun was always blocked by the building and the gym was being upgraded. The rooms were very nice. I was some time ago when I stayed but i've been poor at reviewing... for the same price i could get an amazing marina view hotel so no real purpose to staying here.

Reviews.Title: “First class stay”
Reviews.Author: Stephen D
Reviews.Content: Always a first class stay at this hotel. Staff at all levels are very friendly and professional and nothing is too much trouble. Club lounge an oasis of peace most of the time, although the breakfast selection is slightly limited. This is perhaps due to constraints of space of the lounge and in any case I could also have taken breakfast in the main restaurant. Perhaps the only criticism (and this is across the Sheraton range) is that the bathrooms are relatively small and they still have a combined bath shower with curtain. This is a minor issue though and I would not hesitate to recommend my friends to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Location ok, but the staff's helpfulness made up the difference”
Reviews.Author: mwardsea
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for five nights. On the first day we checked in super early, 5:00 a.m. Nobody said a word, just checked us right in. We thought we had booked a room for that night. But turned out we messed up our booking and didn't have a room for that night. But they had space and just checked us in without any complaints. Very professional. Overall a great stay, thanks to the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding banquet review”
Reviews.Author: mdoraemon
Reviews.Content: For a five star property, I would expect a better service standard from the wedding sales team. I had an unpleasant experience with Sheraton Towers. The wedding coordinator was not professional when dealing with clients, no matter how displeased you are, you are not supposed to give an unhappy or sulky face to your client. Very rigid policies, nearly every single request is: management do not allow If you want to reject the client's request, that's fine, but please think of alternatives. Bridal Suite was not fantastic because the shower area was small and did not have better graded shower amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Business Hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: michael0357
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights in February at the Sheraton Towers Hotel in Singapore. The location is a bit off from the famous spots like Orchard Road, Clark Quay or Boat Quay, but everythings can be reached in few minutes by taxi or even in 15 minutes by walking. The hotel is a typical Sherton Hotel with all the nice features, which are normally offered by this kind of business hotel. Unfortunately I visisted Singapore during the time of the famous air show and in addition arrival was on Valentines Day, so the hotel was fully booked, Meaning that I had to pay unreasonable high rates.Upon check-in I had to wait quite some time, mainly because of a long queue waiting in front of me, but also because of a somehow unefficient check-in process. Even as data are all available beforehand and reception can prepare everything prior to the arrival, it took too much time in each individual case. To my surprise there was no dedicated check-in available for Starwood Preferred Members. Finally the concierge started to assist the receptionist and the processs speeded up a little. My room was nice and big enough, my king-size bed was very comfortable and all necessary amenities were available. The Sheraton is offereing a couple of different restaurants, all of them at the high end in regard to prices but with good quality, too. Every evening I had a final drink together with colleagues, who were staying there at the same time, at the lobby bar. Nice music but sometimes lousy service. On my first evening the waiter was more busy with greeting his friends, who spent Valentines Day at the Sheraton, than getting us some drinks. The other evenings it was slightly better but a bit unprofessional service. All the waiters and the barkeeper seemed to be newcomers. However, a nice stay all in all at a good business hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Staff made it feel like home on 2 week business stay.”
Reviews.Author: Daniemarie
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel with EXCEPTIONAL service. The staff, calling us by name at all times, was greatly helpful in making our stay feel comfortable and like home. With our busy daily business schedules, all the staff was helpful in assisting us with all our needs. The concierge, Xavier, even came in on his day off to bring us special dietary items we were unable to locate. Continuous, personalized service was amazing! I would suggest the Sheraton Towers to everyone I know visiting Singapore!! and the daily flower arrangements were very, very beautiful!!

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could have stayed longer.”
Reviews.Author: Bob S
Reviews.Content: After a 12-day sailing around the Indonesian islands on the Seabourn Legend, we docked and departed the cruise in Singapore. Unfortunately, many folks had to catch their flight back home that day and missed out on many of the things Singapore has to offer. We allowed for this a spent three days in Singapore staying at the Sheraton Towers. The Sheraton’s location makes it convenient to many shopping centers and restaurants. It is also within walking distance of Newton’s Circus with its food stalls, a good and safe place to eat. The hotel offered the same great rooms and facilities that you would expect to find Sheraton properties. No matter how great the physical property is, it is always the people (staff) that make it or break it for their guest. In this case, Sharon See went over and beyond the call of duty. She was patient, attentive, and extremely helpful in sorting out all of the various shopping and dining options we had. One night we went to the Jumbo Seafood restaurant after Sharon took care of getting us a reservation, it was a great experience. Sharon is a great asset to the reputation and management team of this Sheraton property.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: starlifeplat
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. The rooms have finally caught up with the outstanding service. Last night I checked into a beautifully reonovated room. Big flat screen tv, new carpet, new shower, new furniture. NICE! I have stayed at this hotel before and the service has always been excellent but the rooms were a bit tired. Now that the rooms have been renovated, everything is great. The Executive Lounge is relaxing and is managed by great staff. The Chinese restaurant in the basement is one of the best in Singapore. High quality, yummy dim sum for lunch! The fitness center is kept clean. NIce, friendly and helpful doormen, bell staff and front desk. Good transport options nearby (subway, bus) and 10-15 min walk to Orchard Road. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Hotel at Newton”
Reviews.Author: ieasabel
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Towers is located just few steps from Newton subway station. It is on Orchard road. The main lobby is really amazing and huge like some concert hall. There is live music and restaurants and bar. The lobby & reception staff is very helpfull and kind. The check in and check-out was really quick. Behind reception desk there is business center. The rooms are tidy but a little old style in my opinion. I prefer newly renovated in modern style. The deluxe room was the smallest from Sheraton that I have ever been and the same as bathroom. I had late 4pcheck out and it allows me to sleep to 12pm :) Depending of price I recomend to stay here. A little far from airport but really close to Orchard district.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service in an amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LilPiggyQT
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had stayed at the Sheraton Towers in Singapore for one night in February. The hotel reminded me of other Sheratons I have stayed at in the US but the service set this hotel apart from the ones in the states. We had arrived early in the morning around 10am and wanted to drop our luggage off and to see if there was any rooms ready to check into. They did not have any rooms with two beds yet but was able to take our luggage and the concierge was EXTREMELY helpful in helping us decide what to do in Singapore. The hotel is a short, safe walk from Orchard Road which is the busy shopping street with famous name brand stores. There are many places to eat on or near that road. To the left of the hotel and across the street a little walk away, there is a street food/food stall area with many food choices. Directly to the left of the hotel is the RTS stop. The doormen outside the hotel are also very helpful in giving directions and tips on where to go. After taking a taxi to the botanical gardens and back, we checked in with the front desk again to see if any rooms were ready. They were not, but we asked to use the hotel pool and the front desk lady assured me she would deliver the room keys to me in the pool area once a room was open. The pool is quite large and deep. There is a sauna and steam room in the pool area vicinity along with the gym on the same floor/area. As me and my friend were in the pool, the front desk lady did come up to deliver the keys as promised. I was very impressed with her service! There is a business area to use for hotel guest but usually for 15 minutes at a time. I know that the hotel does have a restaurant or two but I did not eat in the hotel. The hotel room looks like any other Sheraton room, with drinks and snacks to purchase. The beds were more firm than I was accustomed to though I was able to fall sleep very easily. The room lights can be controlled by the clock on the nightstand. Overall, I had a fantastic night here in the Sheraton Towers and would stay here again. The service from the front desk, the concierge, and the doormen made me feel welcome and made my stay in Singapore much more inviting.

Reviews.Title: “Great restaurants”
Reviews.Author: Jejo7779
Reviews.Content: I dined in DOMVS restaurant of this hotel and was surprised to know that a local chef has the capability to cook superb Italian food. The quality of the food they serve is great and their service are great too. Highly commendable place for fine dining.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore Conference”
Reviews.Author: Tony960
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hotel, professional and friendly staff and lovely emenities. The breakfasts were fantasic. The only downside was the price, you could stay for twice as long in other good hotels for the price charged here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: G K
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Towers has a great location, very central. The staff is incredibly caring, service is great, rooms are comfortable and very clean and executive lounge is wonderful. Shortly, it is a very good choice for especially business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Don't read the other reviews...this place is much nicer than they suggest!”
Reviews.Author: BeckyBall
Reviews.Content: As my husband is a Starwood ambassador who travels all the time I consider myself a bit of an expert on Starwood hotels and hotels around Asia. I booked this hotel on points with low expectations and almost didn't book it because of the poor reviews. The hotel is much, much better than the reviews! I stayed in a refurbished reviews that can only be described as grand. Anything in the bathroom that can be marble, is (even down to polished marble floors, which are found throughout Asia to my chagrin). The bed is comfy, the executive lounge top notch albeit with a smaller selection than some other Starwood properties, and the lobby is exquisite. If you like marble or orchids you will love this hotel. My biggest grievance is that the pool doesn't take advantage of all of the sunlight. I like sunbathing, and like many other Starwood properties part or all of the pool area is in the shade when the sun is shining, which is all too rare in Singapore with the rainstorms. This isn't something unique to the hotel, but my biggest grievance. Also, upon check in I was given free executive lounge access and Internet in the rooms. Hurrah! I truly believe Internet in the room should be standard at all luxury hotels (the price is really high here otherwise) and lounge access should be granted to anyone booking on points. But that's just me and may not be a fair expectation. Just make sure to ask for a renovated room. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel in need of an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: SFLeonce
Reviews.Content: We reently spend two nights at the Sheraton Towers Singapore and found it to be a typical, average Sheraton branded hotel - unfortunately. What we did like: The executive lounge was very nicely decorated, the staff friendly and the food/beverage selection very good. The staff is very friendly and helpful, especially the staff at the (very nice) gym was super nice providing us a locker to leave a change of clothes until we left later that night. The location is good with direct access to the subway system, one stop from Orchard Road. What we did not like: The rooms desperately need upgrading, the carpet was worn and dirty, the wooden cabinets had scratches, the entire room was dark, the balcony lights did not work and the TV is a 80´s square box. In my opinion everything needs to be replaced... The breakfast selection is fine, but nothing has any flavour...does not compare to many other Sheraton hotels we stayed at. The public areas are just ok, again in need of an upgrade. In general, for the amount of money they charge, especially in high-demand times, one can stay at significantly better hotels - and next time we will.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at a good location...”
Reviews.Author: RuediAbtwil_Schweiz
Reviews.Content: From check in to (very) late check out a totally enjoyable experience. The first suite I had for two nights might or is in need of an upgrade renovation but those are planned as far as I know. The executive room given upon my return (for points and cash!) incl. the super late complimentary check out was very nice, extremely clean and comfortable. The 3rd floor club lounge left nothing open for improvement: great choice of food/snacks/drinks. The entire staff made sure that my stay was welcoming! Location is great, being that you are right outside of the hustle & bustle. Will surely return!

Reviews.Title: “Good location old hotel”
Reviews.Author: mann_mm
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near to some shopping malls and Newton Food Centre. The Newton MRT station is just 5 minutes walk. But when we first get the hotel room, one of the corner of the bathtub was broken. How can a hotel can let guests to use a broken bathtub, it is too dangerous and not hygienic. Then we go to the front desk and requested to change the room. Two bottled water is included in the room rate. The breakfast is good with lots of food (Chinese, Japanese and western etc) to choose.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel.maintenance is poor”
Reviews.Author: HolidayAdvisorIndia
Reviews.Content: Plumbing and air conditioning is poor.There is a strange smell in the corridors. The swimming pool is pathetic with no service at the pool side. The breakfast is below average.location is good but only for shopping.we moved out after three days and stayed at a hotel in Clark quay.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: VeronaB
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed staying in this hotel. We were initially given the wrong key cards to access the rooms. This was quickly rectified though. We were also told at check-in that we had adjoining rooms, but found it was only adjacent rooms. Upon questioning this we were told they had no adjoining rooms available. This was not a major issue but we should not have been given the wrong information from the start. The rooms were spacious and neat. Staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel and grounds are lovely but nothing spectacular. Location is very good and easily accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at the Sheraton Towers in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Ming_Travels
Reviews.Content: This is our third stay at the hotel, and this was a fabulous experience again. Amazing service and the staff is really friendly, from doorman, to receptionist, housekeeper and F&B staff. The gym is perfectly equipped, and the outdoor pool is not only pleasant, but great for swimming as well as play. Location of the hotel is very convenient, close to Orchard Street, and short taxi distance to all Singapore attractions. Rooms are quite comfortable overall. We were only going to stay one night, but decided to extend another two, and the staff was really helpful in the process.

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed in nicer places. Chinese restaurant is great.”
Reviews.Author: anneliemc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July on route to Malaysia. We had a rewards room so we weren't expecting much. The rooms were okay but a little dated. The breakfast was really good and so was the chinese restaurant. My children loved the food.

Reviews.Title: “Another outstanding Starwood Experience”
Reviews.Author: Louise_W40
Reviews.Content: This being my first stay at the Sheraton Towers and the fact I was only in Singapore for 2 nights and 1 full day, my experience of all the hotel's amenities was fairly limited. I used the pool and enjoyed the spaciousness of the area. The weather was such that it was not conducive to me using the gym, but after checking out the facilities, I committed to memory that I should do so if I happened to visit next when the climate was cooler. I used Room Service during my stay which I could not fault. Worth a mention: Upon checking in, I was informed that some floors were being refurbished. To ensure guests were not affected by any noise or inconvenience, they were placed in rooms far removed from the renovations. That being said, I would have had no idea any works were being undertaken. Absolutely no disruption or no noise. I appreciated the upfront candour, given that I have been in hotels previously where this has not been a consideration and subsequently have had to request a room transfer, or suffer the noise and inconvenience in a high season occupancy. My room was very much in keeping with most Starwood city properties, which has never disappointed. As one previous reviewer mentioned, the shower was in the bath and there was a shower curtain, however, given the size of the bathroom, which was generous, it provided the best of both worlds - a bath and a shower - and the curtain was pristine and new. Sharon See, Director of Rooms, went above and beyond the call of duty happening to be at the wrong place at the wrong time where I was concerned, after not being able to access my room with my key due to being on the wrong floor to start with. Every effort was made by Ms. See to accompany me personally to sort things out. And when we met again per chance on my check-out, Ms. See assisted me with organising some additional items via Housekeeping on my departure. I cannot fault the standard and level of service I received during my stay at the Sheraton Towers - all team members were friendly and courteous and any queries I had were attended to immediately. I would highly recommend this hotel - whether it be for families or the corporate sector - it is close and convenient to the main shopping hub, offering the high standard of service one comes to expect from the Starwood chain of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “One more time thanks to Starwood hotels!!”
Reviews.Author: glou2
Reviews.Content: It's not that this hotel has something wow but it's nothing u could not like! Good location, good rooms, great view!! Friendly staff and the list goes on!!! Thank u for nice weekend is Singapore :-)

Reviews.Title: “Chinese New Year is great in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: BryantheViking71
Reviews.Content: Doing the Year of the Dragon in Singapore is great.....fantastic parade of floats through the city. Restaurants too numerous to pick any out all offering excellent Banquets. Since you only have a Birthday once every 12 years in China celebrating the year in which you were born, we were amazed to find Restaurants packed out at Lunchtime with whole Offices personnel sat around big tables as the celebrated "every bodies Birthday " on the 3rd day of New Year Kong hei fat choi! What a great idea so nobody misses out !And every where you go you see flat back trucks with a Dragon Dance Team on them speeding to their next shop to let in the New Year and bring good luck to the Owners ! Lucky Plaza is a good place for bargains on Orchard Road !

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton above average”
Reviews.Author: MHSyd
Reviews.Content: This is our 3d stay at the Sheraton Towers Singapore...as with most Sheraton hotels in Asia, quite a bit better than the same brand in the US. Great location a few steps from the Singapore subway and within walking distance to Orchard Road and Newton Hawker Center. The hotel is not luxe but very clean, comfortable with attentive staff, very good food and very affordable. If the timing is not right to take the subway to the airport, the hotel will provide a affordable car service. All our stays here (and in Singapore) have been for a few days to lessen the impact of jet lag as we make our way to other areas of Southeast Asia...you really can't go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel near Mtr”
Reviews.Author: AnnieL79
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. Great location as you are few mins from MTR stop. Taxis are also very cheap in Singapore. Was some work going on so was a little noisey in am but we were warned. Room was nice but probably is in need of a little modernism. The curtains let in a lot of light which was a little annoying. Staff were helpful. Pool was nice but could do with few more loungers. Breakfast was nice but not the best we have been to on our long trip. Quite expensive. Location sells this hotel and nice pool!

Reviews.Title: “The Worst of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: bmarcus2011
Reviews.Content: I am an SPG Gold Members and I stay at Starwoods as much as I can. Staying at this property was the Worst Mistake I made on this trip! Prior to my visit I called twice to ensure an early check-in because of my arriving flight and I was told "not a problem it is all taken care of". When I checked-in I learned that they could Not check me in till 10 am. I was cool with that. Then they told me they made a mistake and it was 11 then 12. I got a weak apology from the Front Office Manager. The hotel is in the Worst location of all the major hotel brands in Singapore and you have to go through a construction site and complex crossings to get to Orchird Rd. The room was avergae at best and the pool nades a face lift, like today!! This hotel mainly services business conventions and is Not Tourist Firendly!! In fact, this is the first Starwood I encountered that does Not Even have Free-Wifi in the Lobby. They only give you 10 free minutes in the business center. The Staff were very rude and very passive. If you want to go on holiday this is Not the Hotel for you. It is worth the difference to stay at the Marriott or the Hyatt that is much more centrally located on Orchird Rd. Trust me take my Word For It!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service and experience was positively overwhelming”
Reviews.Author: Tschaller
Reviews.Content: Overnight one night January in Singapore at the Sheraton Towers sSingapore, it is located one block from the Newton MRT stop. Building undergoing renovation during the day - but the employees go out of their way to make it un-noticeable. great lounge singer(s) at the eve happy hour. Shopping is one stop in either direction on the MRT - Newton or Novena stations each have many malls and eating available. Hotel did not nickel and dime the guests like some of the others around the area. Internet access every day - at your leisure and print - no problem. Nice views of downtown fro the rooms. Nightly turn down service - ice and bottled water provided, spacious quiet rooms. My only complaint is the TV choices are limited.

Reviews.Title: “Very dated, wait till renovations are completed”
Reviews.Author: Dobson73
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night on my way through from India to Australia and used SPG points. Very disappointing hotel and the rooms are old and dated. Staff at reception are friendly and I was given early check in and late check out which was appreciated but sadly I was given a room with single beds. However, they're very comfortable and after 3 weeks on hard Indian planks the softness was very welcome. Also given a room on a lower floor to be away from the contraction noise but I wish I'd insisted on a renovated room. Tired, tired, tired. Old box analogue TV, over bath shower with a curtain that clings to you, carpets are brown and just look dodgy even though I'm sure they're not. Once renovation is completed I'm sure the hotel will be restored to it's previously excellent level but give it some time before staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great service”
Reviews.Author: NormStar2010
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel as a stopover for two nights on the way to New Zealand. We found the staff to be very helpful. Had an early check in which allowed us to make full use of our first day in Singapore. The room allocated was good - next to the lift area but this did not cause too much noise. Conciege very helpful with information on getting around. Hotel conveniently situated a couple of minutes walk from the MRT Newton station, and about 10 minutes walk down Scotts Road to the Orchard Road shopping area. We ate out while sightseeing so have no experience of the hotels catering, and did not have time to sample the swimming pool although it looked to be fairly well used. Checking out was swift and an erroneous snack charge was removed from the bill with no problem. Staff were friendly and charming. Would not hesitate to use this hotel on future occasions.

Reviews.Title: “Dated, not the best service, one of the less impressive SPG hotels”
Reviews.Author: Shanghaiasiafan
Reviews.Content: I am an SPG platinum member and I have been for years, and because of my travels around Asia, I stay at SPG hotels quite a bit. I have to say that the Sheraton in Singapore is the worst SPG hotel in Asia that I have stayed at. In fact, now Singapore is the only city in Asia where I travel to that I avoid the SPG chain. The St. Regis, a fine hotel, is often more than I want to pay. I hear there is a Westin coming and I cannot wait. The beds are comfy. The executive lounge is outstanding in service and comfort. But that's about it. Most rooms still have CRT box TVs - you don't even see that in budget hotels anymore. In this hotel more than any other I have waited the longest to be checked in or checked out. The doorman often seems disinterested when I arrive to check in. The only hotel where I rarely get an upgrade ( I get it without asking at all other SPG hotels). Often the reception does not even apologize. Carpet is old. Bathrooms older. It seems the owners just want to milk the money and have waited too long to upgrade. Charging $350+ for this hotel is outrageous. Now...I stay at the Shangri-La. I am a loyal SPG member but this one has almost made me switch. Please...wait till the refurbishment is done. I hope they are not being cheap with it. Or wait for the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel with perfect location”
Reviews.Author: shubz81
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotel on scoots road very near to orchard road. and main thing is metro line is only 2 mins walk . you will love the bed of this hotel and they have a huge lobby . i was lucky enought to got promoted to executive lounge where you will get free breakfast and evening cocktail so be a member of spg and enjoy benifits . must visit you will love this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel near Orchard from starwood chain”
Reviews.Author: ksiazemati
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sheraton Towers Singapore for 1 night, really to collect a stay from SPG bonus system. The hotel is located quite far from the Chiangi airport ( nearly 30 S$D by cab). But few steps from hotel there is Newton subway station - red line. So from airport You can take green lina and then make switch for red. By the walk from the hotel there is Orchard district - many malls, shops with best brands. By the metro it is just one station. The hotel lobby is really enormous and fancy. Live music and concerts. There is huge conference center. The hotel and room service is high quality. I give 4 stars because of room. The rooms need renovation and are quite in old style, like sheratons earlier. Especially I have claims according to the room main doors, You can hear everything from outside. There is gym and pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Stiza82
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time here. Clean rooms, friendly staff, and good food. Located really really near the main shops on Orchard road. Like a 7 minute walk. Convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Efficient Service, Average Rooms”
Reviews.Author: LovetravellingDXB
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is very good, only one MRT station away from Orchard. Also, Newton Hawker Centre is only 5 minutes walk. We were a group of 7 and check in was handled efficiently. Our room preferences were given as requested. The rooms were quite old, as we were not allocated the newly refurbished rooms. One of the room key card was not working at 5 am so had to go down to the reception twice to get it fixed. Snacks and drinks at the lobby bar was ok, nothing special. Would return for the location. Next time will request for the newly refurbished rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Time for the wrecking ball or a major refurb”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneRichie
Reviews.Content: Despite great service, very professional staff and a pretty good location, this hotel is way past its use by date. If you're going to spend money staying at a Starwood hotel in Singapore, pay a few dollars extra and go to St. Regis which is worlds apart and often not much more expensive. The rooms at Sheraton are small and just not coping with their age. I messed around for hours with a faulty internet connection, annoying crusty old bathroom etc etc. The pool is not a fraction as nice as St. Regis and feels like something out of an old Las Vegas hotel. Despite this negativity, the Exec Lounge is quite nice, if you have access, and the staff and service are top notch, professional, friendly, remember your name and acknowledge your return with a fruit platter or nice gesture of some kind.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you get a refurbished room!”
Reviews.Author: kgbgirl
Reviews.Content: My experience was positive, and after reading some of the reviews regarding ancient and poor quality room furbishing, all I can say is, try to reserve a room on 15th or 18th floor -- as of my stay, these were the two floors that were refurbished. Though I wouldn't call them luxury, they are very comfortable, with real king-size bed, flat screen TV, the bathroom is very acceptable. Service, in my experience, was good and staff was responsive to the couple of hiccups that occurred. Giving it an 'average' rating because of my expected standard for a 4.5* property -- they met it, but didn't exceed, thus the rating.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable with quality”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyboyFinland
Reviews.Content: I stayed there on business in November 16-18. Not my first time there, and keep returning to this hotel. Service is good and location satisfactory. Walk to Orchard road takes 20 mins. Tip, try the food market across the street and left from the main entrance. There you can find cheap and tasty meals with kitchens from Thailand, India, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy stay, just steps away from Orchard”
Reviews.Author: DACHALADACHA
Reviews.Content: Nice comfy hotel, conform Sheraton standards! Rooms are spacious, well maintained but for me ... Could be refurbished, not that it looks worn or whatsoever... But more too classic, old fashioned! A pitty is that they charge you for wi fi connection, even you are having drinks in the lobby, you need a paid voucher....!!! Unbelievable... Singapore itself is completely wifi, but Sheraton still charge you for that... In 2011!!! Location wise: very convenient, both for buss. Or leisure travelers! 3 min. Walk to Newton MRT Station and 7 min. O Orchard Rd I will rate average for the rooms, only for the decoration, not for the comfort!!!

Reviews.Title: “Needs renovation badly”
Reviews.Author: Mie22
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Sheraton on our way to Bali. When you enter the hotel, it is like being taken back into the '70's. The hotel needs to renovate its interior and upgrade. The room was a bit small, kinda expected for a hotel in Singapore. Carpet and TV were very old. The TV was still the old type with tube at the back. The bathroom was small but functional. The bed was very comfortable. Plus points: Convenient. Very near an MRT station. Good service Minus points: Very old. Very outdated interior.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable with limited appeal”
Reviews.Author: Moneyfools
Reviews.Content: Spent a week here on business. Room is large with the double bed being two singles pushed together. Breakfast had a good selection but staff were either too quick trying to clear a plate that wasn't finished (for something to do) or totally oblivious to plates stacking up (as too busy talking to each other). However, noise between rooms seems to be a weakness, one can hear baths and showers running in rooms above and to the side often at 1am in the morning. The (old) TV had its sound set very low and the handset control didn't work and the adjustment panel on the TV was screwed shut with a philips screw! Minimal choice of channels. Internet is not free anywhere in hotel and costs S$10 per hour or $21 per day! Newton MRT station is next door (left out of hotel) and Orchard Road a 15 minute walk (right out of hotel). Until the refurbishment is completed other hotels offer more appeal.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, comfortable rooms!”
Reviews.Author: jkryptos
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the hotel a few times I've been to S'pore. Its a good property with very comfortable rooms. And for its price, a very good option in Singapore. The staff is courteous too. What I liked most about the hotel is its location. Within 5 mins (by cab), you can reach Orchard street - the busiest and most happening shopping street in Singapore.You can find all the big brands there. Not just that, at a minute's walk from the hotel is an MRT station (Newton). Thus travelling around the city becomes very convenient. And the hotel is away from all the hustle bustle providing you with just the peace you'll need. The hotel's pool is ordinary. However, The restaurants at the hotel serve sumptuous food. Overall, a very good hotel mostly for business purposes.

Reviews.Title: “Good but could do with some small improvements”
Reviews.Author: Alan K
Reviews.Content: Generally a great place to stay, rooms are nice and well acquainted. The upgrade to the Club floor or facilities makes sense as it covers Internet and breakfast for the same price. But you should be able to choose the club floor or main restaurant for breakfast which is typical with most hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel for businessman and tourist folks”
Reviews.Author: SaurabhGupta_84
Reviews.Content: Stayed 15 days at Sheraton Towers. It was home away from home. Nice cosy room, decent services. Nice pool and gym. Very friendly staff, always welcoming and helping. Nearby MRT station. Breakfast options available are continental but as well served Indian dishes.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre, but to be accepted with an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: masmiguelDusseldorf
Reviews.Content: When you enter the hotel you already observe how old this house is: The recepionists need suplementary aircon or dryers sized small fridges. Obviously not all the rooms had a safebox, so there was a safe-box area left of the reception. All the hotel to be refurbished, quickly! Anyway, having payed the upgrades us to a tower room, which was small but Singapore-clean, and gave us a lounge access, which ment no fees for wifi, small breakfast, small afternoon food and (obviously all the lounge guests made use of it) free wine in the afternoon. The staff was very polite and effective. Anyway, the subway and a food market with small restos are close, but Orchard Road is a 1km walk in humid Singapore far from the hotel, I would prefer a hotel closer to whatever I want to have close bye in Singapore. The hotel-area is more a residence area.

Reviews.Title: “OK but nothing around”
Reviews.Author: TokyoSalaryMan
Reviews.Content: The hotel was decent - a usual Sheraton. The breakfast had a really good selection of food the days I was there. The metro is a very short walk. The only complaint is that there is nothing around it. I couldn't even find a place to buy water. I did find a 7-11 quite close though. Go into the metro and walk past the entry gates. The 7-11 is just past that on the right (underground). There is also a good food court (food hawker stalls) behind the metro on the opposite side of the street. Walk behind the metro and take the food bridge over the main road in behind.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable but rather old”
Reviews.Author: fmkyfc
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night using my points and cash. I must agree with everyone that this place is rather old and need some refurbishment. The location is good if you are looking for somewhere outside the Orchard strip. There is a MRT station 2 mins walk away. To be fair everything is there it just look tired. If they offer a good deal and you dont mind the tied look and older feel to the place it is an okay place.

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated rooms a huge improvement!”
Reviews.Author: Kenpoh
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in the Sheraton Towers a couple of times before this - but all these while, the only reason I came back here was for the loyalty SPG points. I've also tried other similarly priced hotels such as the Marina Mandarin last time I was in Singapore and price for price, the Marina was better - newer, cleaner, better location(the shopping mall was just downstairs!). I always had a bit of regret coming back to Sheraton Towers ...that is until today! I was given a recently renovated room on the 17th floor and boy was it a significant improvement from the last time I stayed here. It is now what you can truly call - 'Sheraton' standard - well, almost! it doesn't look super luxurious but before this it felt more like a 2-3 star hotel. The TV is new and stylish (its still lacking some channels, and there's not much variety sadly - great looking TV but nothing good on). The room looks mostly the same a before but there's a few hidden nice touches - the room controls are noticebly new - the drawers and minibars looks nice - and the bathroom - spotless. There's a also a sky-shower like faucet and a bigger tub(or maybe its just my imagination!) Water pressure could be improved but its definitely hot enough :) Internet is fast, but unfortunately not free and not cheap! Its 21SGD per device for 24 hours - there are other daily, weekly, monthly plans even. I definitely feel less 'regret' checking in to Towers now than before :) For first timers, there's an MRT nearby as you walk out of the hotel - go left. probably 100-200 meters. Orchard road is just a few stops away, its not near but not that far either - but you probably don't want to walk on a hot and humid day. There's a "circus" food court nearby but I don't recommend it as its mostly a tourist trap (exorbitant prices, average food). You're better off finding stuff in the middle of Orchard probably. Overall its not a bad place to stay if you're in Singapore - location not too bad, rooms are definitely above average now, (though they could have used a bit more check in staff, there was only one manning the station while I was checking in - but she was nice and friendly enough! - even gave me a call to make sure I was okay with the room I got!). The lobby does look old and a bit outdated but if you don't hang around there much it shouldn't really bother you that much :) I'm attaching as many pictures I can to show the state of the rooms - it's nicer than last time trust me, it doesn't look luxurious but it's definitely an improvement!

Reviews.Title: “cozy”
Reviews.Author: jtkJakarta
Reviews.Content: I have stayed many times over the last 10 years at the Sheraton Singapore. Style and decor are somewhat outdated; however, it is a cozy place. Staff is friendly and professional. Roomsize is good, with a nice sizes bathroom as well, although there is no separate shower. The location is fine, Orchard Road is within walking distance, and a subway station is about 200 meters away.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, but so 1980s.”
Reviews.Author: nat_travel_17
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Sheraton Towers. We chose this hotel because we got a great deal with Starwood points. The hotel is fine if you don't mind the 80s style interior. The hotel is very much outdated and needs a good upgrade: old fashioned 'box' type tv, instead of flat screen, outdated interior, and a swimming pool which needs some serious retiling. In addition I thought the bathroom was very small and the breakfast buffet below average for the price we had to pay. On the positive side, I have to say that the staff were very friendly, especially Daniel the bellman. Also, the hotel room was clean, the beds quite comfortable and location was fine (near Newton Circus and Newton MRT station, 10 min walk from Orchard Rd.).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Good location.”
Reviews.Author: Scrawl
Reviews.Content: Good option if you want to be a bit off Orchard Road. Rooms are a little old fashioned perhaps but grand otherwise. Pretty standard western hotel other than that.

Reviews.Title: “Great service but priced to high”
Reviews.Author: Manuel R
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the towers for a week during a business trip during the end of august and the beginning of September 2011. From the time you arrive the valet is very welcoming and friendly, lobby is beautiful and the front desk personnel are excellent. The bell boys are ready to serve you and they don't expect that much tip but their service is worth a nice one. The rooms are nice and clean, however, I was expecting something nicer for the money I paid per night $300.00 sin/ dollars. Breakfast was between 21 and $40 dollars per day and the close restaurant or place to eat was at least a 15 min walk with a 80% humidity waring a suit it didn't feel good. Also, for use of the internet you had to a daily fee of $29.96 Sin. I had to use the dry cleaning service an they charged me $147.00 sin for a couple of dress shirts, some 4 t-shirts, a few pair of socks and a handkerchief. The pool and gym facility were average and clean. They also have a SPA which one of my co-worker used and the service was very good according to her. Security wasn't a concern at any time in Singapore and the people are very educated and friendly. The food at the hotel restaurant is great and everywhere else too. There is a subway station 1/2 a block away from the hotel and taxi,s are everywhere. I'll add photos later.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel, but unremarkable”
Reviews.Author: Kingmaker
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because it is very handy for my office. For leisure travellers it's a little bit out of the heart of things - although nothing is too far away in Singapore. The room was a good middle of the road business room. At the back of the hotel it is very quiet and nice to see a bit of greenery beyond the hotel. The gym is good and has a nice glass wall looking out over the pool area. The pool is also very pleasant, however I only saw one person either sitting beside it or in it for al 5 days that I stayed here. I think that because all of the hotel rooms (at least at the back of the hotel) look directly out onto it, it is quite intimidating to be out there. I had breakfast on one of the mornings and it was not great - certainly not for $30US plus. So no complaints, but having stayed in some lovely hotels across Asia, the only reason I will come back here is because its across the road from the office

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: ConnecticutCycleMan
Reviews.Content: I stayed her over 50 nights in 2010 and many more nights in peck us years. The concierge staff are known to me on a first name basis as are the Billy at the front driveway. I recommended this hotel to my manager and she was use to staying at the local Four Seasons, she liked it so much that she came back to this Sheraton again.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy address, faded glories”
Reviews.Author: jonathanshawThailand
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in October 2011 for four nights. I figured that for the fancy room rate, the rooms would be exquisite. Obviously not. I've no idea when this property was last renovated, but the rooms are very 1980s. The bathroom is tiny, with a tub you have to climb into to have a shower (no problem with this in cheaper hotels, but for SGD 350?), the television is an old fashioned cathode ray version, with its own fat wooden cabinet taking up too much space, and the carpet is a little unhygienic. Internet connections are steep, and did not work in the conference room or lobby - only the bedroom. Very poor value. The safe in room 820 did not lock, and assistance arrived too slowly to fix it - so I had to spend time craftily hiding valuables and locking my suitcase. The toilet was hard to flush. On the plus side: location, the shower temperature fully adjustable, and the bed was wonderfully comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Among the best”
Reviews.Author: jland0001
Reviews.Content: This is perhaps one of the great hotels of the world. In the times I've stayed here, when I arrive at the airport, there is a representative of the hotel there to greet me and put me into the taxi. I handed my bags to the taxi and the next time I see them is in my room. When I arrive at the hotel, I am escorted (early in the morning) directly to my room and I am checked in there and offered a night cap. When I leave clothes on the floor, and go about my daily business, they are laundered and hanging in my closet when I return. The restaurant has a great breakfast. The whole experience at the hotel is nothing like anything I've experienced in any other hotel in the world. Checking out is just as pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Very competent but lacking that je ne sais quoi?”
Reviews.Author: sendaiben
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night (sept 2011) here with my wife. We booked a king tower exec lounge room (I don't have Starwood status so wasn't upgraded). The good Room was nice (it was a renovated room apparently) and clean: good city view The buffet breakfast was extensive and not crowded first thing in the morning 8 pieces of laundry included in room rate (they expedited this for us too as we had an early departure) Staff attentive and friendly, especially in lounge Resolved bill issue quickly and with no fuss The bad Location is somewhat out of the way Overall A competent and functional hotel We were perhaps a little jaded coming from the St Regis Osaka We'll probably try other places before returning here

Reviews.Title: “Go for club room & service”
Reviews.Author: RichardU71
Reviews.Content: Had read the poor reviews and was a bit uncofortable travelling there but no need to worry. Just make sure you get one of the spacious club rooms. I agree with some of the comments that the hotel is a bit dated and it def needs an upgrade. The technology in the hotel is clearly gifted from one of the bond movies from the 80s. Anyhow, apart from that I didn't see a problem. Don't get me wrong, its not a 5 star super resort but for a businenss traveller it will do the trick. Good lobby area with plenty of room for working. Exec club is actually in great shape and the service there top notch. Rooms are spacious but dated (but clean and ok). A couple of good restaurants (not the least the Chinese) and generally good service. I wouldn't have a problem going back there next time I am in Singapore. Just make sure you get a good room.

Reviews.Title: “One night stop over in singapore”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi P
Reviews.Content: So arriving at 3am is not a good start only to find we were not given interconnecting rooms even though we speficially asked for them and this was confirmed. We always stay in Starwood properties and this service was not up to scratch. Nevertheless the breakfast in the club lounge as always saved the day. So overall for very late guests the hotel was really organized but we will stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Now I know why they want you to pay up front.”
Reviews.Author: MarkSYWong
Reviews.Content: Location for most will not be convenient as it is rather far up Orchard Road and impossible to get a taxi at off peak hours. For the same amount of money, you are much better off at the Marina Bay Sands or the Fullerton. These are much closer to downtown, loads of taxi cabs and walking distance almost anywhere. The Sheraton is just too far from everything. Now to the hotel, you know there's an issue when they have some sort of air-cleansing contraption running in the hallway 24-7. The rooms are quite dated, the rug hasn't been changed in ages, and the construction noise from the Hamilton is intolerable (and starts at 8:00 a.m. on the dot). I'm a Gold Preferred Member and didn't receive a suite/room upgrade, and had to call twice for management to properly apply the 20% discount to the internet and laundry services as part of my package. Concierge was also never available via the phone and good luck trying to get a hold of someone at the front desk. BTW, counting money and closing the books is a much higher priority than addressing a customer's concerns (even if that customer is staying with you for 2 weeks). You pay just as much as the 4-5 star hotels around, you are further away from the action, the hotel is 10-20 years older than the hotels of the same price, AND you have to pay for your entire stay up front, so you can't MOVE when the construction is intolerable, or the mold permeates your nose. Side Note: Li Bai is one of, if not the best Chinese restaurants in all of Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: Dbarashi
Reviews.Content: Ok hotel in ok location. Old and needs renovation. Club service was good and worth the extra.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Rooms & service”
Reviews.Author: adnil0411
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here late August 2011 and the rooms and service were excellent, also the buffet lunch very nice and well priced, loved the New Zealand oysters. Only problem was they were having a lot of works done and it was difficult to get taxi's to stop. Their location is quite remote from all the shopping areas

Reviews.Title: “Good But”
Reviews.Author: bob349
Reviews.Content: Location for me was convenient. The room was recently refurbished hence very comfortable. As a platinum member I was given an upgraded room and had access to the lounge. The lounge though comfortable was lacking in choice of wines and the snacks offered were not attractive. The biggest disappointment was the restaurant meal. When brought to my table the knife was so dull it would not cut the meat. The replacement knife was sharper but the meat was so tough that the only way to be able to eat the meat was to tear it apart. I raised the issue with the waiter and main course was deducted from the bill and I was offered another choice. Later in the evening I suffered from an upset stomach which must been caused by the Caesar salad as this was my only meal of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Notalgia buffs rejoice”
Reviews.Author: fletch4366
Reviews.Content: Do you miss the 21 inch tube television you had in your college dorm room in 1991? You're in luck, it's in your room here at the Sheraton Towers. Washesd out colors... YES... bad sound... YES. In this day and age, a 20 year television (50/60 hz) delivery vs. my home model with has a 600 hz delivery needs to be relegated to a more discount brand. When you're paying nearly 300 per night (SGD), a cheap aging television is the last thing a business traveller wants to see after long flights and longer meetings. I'm only here becuase my SPG status obligated an upgrade. If this is it, I feel sorry for those who aren't starwood regulars and are pushed to a lower sodcial levle witha black and white TV's.? showing nothing but NPR or PBS.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: KoushikChakraborty
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel,although situated quite far from the city if you have gone to Singapore as a tourist.However with the availability of cabs this was not a major constraint.Room and breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Dare to called a Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: EdwardPrasetya
Reviews.Content: Sheraton... A five star impression... Is there any half star for rating? When I heard that I will stay at Sheraton during our medical check up I was exciting to feel that. But after check in the room.... what the f***... And you dare to called it Sheraton. 1. No 4 star hotel use joined twin bed for the king size bedroom. Do u know a kingsize bed? 2. The bathroom is so dirty and the toilet.... owgh... 3. Is there any 4 star hotel use a tube TV nowadays???? Get real.... 4. Channel TV???? < 20, Come On... 5. The breakfast??? The worst breakfast I ever had.... And this is the good one... Nice India doorman....

Reviews.Title: “I'll find another place to stay next time”
Reviews.Author: jinphil_cho
Reviews.Content: Did a quick weekend trip to Singapore from Hong Kong thanks to the low airfares between the two cities while United still runs its 747s. It was one of those whim type of things so I decided to just walk into the Sheraton Towers to get a room for a night or two. The front desk person quoted me a rather obscene 380 SGD for one night, but as it was late at night and I was too tired to try to haggle or try another hotel, I decided to bite the bullet for one night. The room was very unimpressive, I think the Airport Crowne Plaza which I previously thought was overpriced is actually better. The room was obviously clean, as this is Singapore, but I never really felt I got what I paid 380 SGD/night for. The Newton MRT and Food Centre (closed when I was there) are very close which was somewhat redeeming although those were considerations which brought me to the hotel in the first place. I will definitely stay elsewhere next time though. I would be OK with paying even 500+ SGD/night for a hotel room if I felt I got my money's worth, but I never felt that during my stay here. Actually, even the way some of the staff looked at me made me feel a bit uncomfortable at times.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Billingsontour
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel with great staff and that excellent Singapore service you always love and expect in this great city. The hotel is close to everything either via taxi or subway and yet slighty on its own with the parks close by.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite what it was...”
Reviews.Author: DoesNotGetOutMuch
Reviews.Content: There's enough on the site to tell you this hotel needs a redo. What does someone considering the Sheraton need to know? 1. Its very close to Newton Circus SMRT station - one stop to Orchard then on to the City, Geylang and Marina. Down hill walk to Orchard road takes 10-15 mins. You could SMRT from Airport but taxi is less than $20. 2. It has all the basics you need but is closer to Holiday Inn than usual Sheraton Towers. 3. If you get deal its value. Spg site offered me $S215 and thats a deal. A friend got a room on Priceline for $US119 in June - thats a deal The rooms are OK but dated. TV not flat screen (not an issue for me), bathroom OK. The buffet breakfast was good including eggs cooked to order etc. It was included in my rate. The pool is big with nice surrounds. Check in was poor. I got stuck behind mainland Chinese trying to work through the issues of haggling down their rate for CNY - give me a break!. Several staff stuck their heads out from the back but it took 15 mins for any to come. They did offer late check out since i arrived around midnight.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful Hotel Trading solely on it's name - avoid at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: crouchie
Reviews.Content: The hotel has just started it's renovations and yet still wants to charge top dollar for the pleasure of staying a long way from Orchard in an old ratty room (CRT TV!). Paid an extra 150++ in order to upgrade to a renovated room only to find a room that looks old and dated in spite of being brand new! For the now 400++ I could have been in the Hyatt: right on Orchard, larger more spacious room, nicer, contemporary decor and breakfast included. Shame on you Sheraton for trying to profit from a sub-standard hotel! You don't deserve your 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: “Awful Value”
Reviews.Author: prohotelguest
Reviews.Content: BADLY DATED AND RUN DOWN is what their own website describes "timeless style and grace". I believe that this hotel was already outdated on the day it opened. The choice of finishes and furniture is distasteful now, and was then. The design and condition of the Front Desk Area is simply appalling. Rooms are small and are badly plagued with mildew. Old fashioned TV sets, bad ones at that. Intermittent Internet service, which comes at a very high price. Bathtubs with shower curtains, no separate showers. Club lounge breakfast and happy hour food is way below standard. A floor-by-floor renovation is ongoing at the hotel. One should make sure to avoid the floor directly below the construction. Come to think of it, should consider avoiding the hotel altogether until it is brought up to 21st century standard. Location is convenient, not far from Orchard Road, and right next to the Newton MRT (subway) station. Staff is adequate. Starwood is thinly spread in Singapore. Since the closing of Le Meridien, it is left only with Sheraton Towers, and recently opened St. Regis. This is not nearly adequate. If one wants to stay at a Starwood hotel, should opt for the St. Regis, which is new, elegant and up-to-date, and which for about a 10% higher (paid) rate is a far better value.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but hotel is quite old”
Reviews.Author: Angiiiangle
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a good location and close to MRT. The hotel room is quite old and should be refurbished. TV is small and outdate. It is a must to change. We are SPG platinum member and we were not offered to upgraded to the best available upon our arrival with the reason our reservation is made through the travel agency. In fact, the hotel did not recognize my SPG status at all. My travel agency has submitted my SPG number together with the reservation but somehow, the hotel advise that nothing has been received. There were lines at the reception counter due to there were only 2 staffs on duty at all times. However, after a long talk and insist, they manage to upgrade me on our last night to a suite room. (??) The hotel also refused to give me points due to the travel agency booking. In Middle East and other continents, I always use travel agency and always get points but not here. The management should have looked and review this policy. We like the location but not the services here. Must be one of the worst Sheraton we had ever been in term of service and room style. In room internet, connection is bad and low signal for wireless access.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service; A bit of a walk to Orchard St.”
Reviews.Author: JennyKiz
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for a couple of days' trip with my husband. Got there at 1030ish am, and it took us at least 20 minutes to check-in - no one was at the SPG counter and there was a long line. Upon checkin we were told that our room was not yet ready so we left to get some lunch and came back at 130ish - our room still wasn't ready. We waited at the lounge UNTIL 3PM - seriously, how long does it take to clean a room?!? When we got to our room we were expecting our luggage to be sent up without having to tell them - no luck. Called them to followup. After 10 minutes room service knocked on our door and asked which luggage did we need help sending DOWN. I was dumbfounded - uhhhh we JUST checked-in?? We need our luggage to be sent UP not DOWN! Took them 20 more minutes til we got our luggage. Pretty much wasted our entire day. Plus their suite was just okay - not up to SPG's typical luxurious standards. Hotel building's pretty old I guess. The only great thing about our stay was that the executive lounge had free drinks and finger foods during happy hour.

Reviews.Title: “Faded Glory”
Reviews.Author: Musqat
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at this hotel every time I'm in Singapore as I'm a Platinum member of the SPG program. (The only other property,until next year's opening of the W, is the St. Regis, which, for me, is usually too expensive both dollar and point wise). The pluses, for me, are: 1). convenient location which allows me to take the MRT from the airport to Newton (S$2), which is a 1- minute walk from the hotel. In addition, I can walk to Orchard Road in about 5 minutes. 2). I usually get a suite. 3). The Club Lounge is quite nice and offers a good selection of food for breakfast and evening cocktails. 4). I can stay for points +US$60. (I'd never pay S$300, which is the usual room rate including tax). Minuses: Rooms are fairly small and showing their age. 2). The check-in staff, unlike the wonderful lounge staff, are not the friendliest I've ever come across. Looking forward to the new Westin in Marina Bay, but, unfortunately, it's not due to open until 2014.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a night or two”
Reviews.Author: Gary H
Reviews.Content: I stay at this property multiple times per year, but only as a way to continue requalifying as a Starwood Platinum guest. When I am in Singapore for more than a night or two I will stay at other places as the pricing is about the same as the Sheraton and there are too many reasons NOT to stay here: 1. Location--OK, the Newton MRT is next door and the Newton Food Center is a short walk away, but that's it. If you want to go anywhere else in town or shop you need to take the MRT there. 2. Old and musty--I understand that the rooms are being remodeled but even in one of the newer rooms there is a musty smell. 3. TV--old TV's and poor channel selection. I would expect at least AXN to be available! 4. Executive lounge food--poor with virtually no selection for either breakfast or evenings. The downstairs restaurant is quite good for breakfast buffet and a much better choice. 5. Staff...while much of the staff, primarily around the bars and restaurants are fantastic, I have found some of the back-office staff and management to be less than stellar. I will continue to stay here, but only until I requalify on my status. As I said, any stay longer than two nights is absolutely going to be somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Not worthy of a Sheraton property. Call in the renovators now Sheraton!”
Reviews.Author: shanosV8
Reviews.Content: As a frequent business stayer at Sheratons in Asia region, but not having stayed this one before, it was a disappointing experience overall. Sheraton Towers Singapore is just not up to scratch for what is supposed to be a premium hotel brand. Property BADLY needs a complete overhaul throughout. Decor is old and tired. Fittings and fixtures are so 1970's e.g. small CRT TV in a cupboard; and I have not seen a shower curtain in a top chain hotel for over 20 years! Carpets are worn, room stale and musty smell. Jug did not work, and internet kept dropping out. Come on Sheraton, wake up and read these reviews on this hotel. This property is not worthy of Sheraton name. Before this hotel I stayed at Sheraton HK Towers and after stayed Sheraton Imperial KL. Now those are proper Sheratons!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but showing it's age”
Reviews.Author: GingerHongKong
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in early July for a few days using our SPG points. I don't think I would have paid full rate to stay here because the rooms are quite small (old fashioned) and look dated. The hotel also smells smoky/musty. On the plus side, the service was ok (full turn down service, etc), the rooms were clean and the pool was lovely for a swim after a hot Singapore day. The hotel is a 5min walk to Orchard Rd so v convenient. Newton MRT and the food centre is also a short walk in the other direction. I would recommend this place if you could get a very cheap deal. Otherwise, I am pretty sure there are bettter places.

Reviews.Title: “I wish our company didn't have a contract with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ozziepore
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't stay here voluntarily if it was the last hotel in Singapore. Last time I had problems, this time also. Unfortunately I travel to Singapore for work (love Singapore, hate this hotel). Pro: the pool is OK Cons: DO NOT stay at this hotel if you want twin beds. My partner came with me this time, we like twin beds rather than one shared bed. The twin beds are single beds, but the last time I slept in a bed this small was when I was on an operating table. Go almost no sleep. Husband said it was like being on a rotisserie - you had to wake up to turn over or you would fall out of bed. At the moment (July 2011) the hotel is doing renovation works on the upper floors. Be warned. We were orginally put on the 17th floor. The noise was really bad - pneumatic drilling and sawing and hammering all day. They just put guests there and hope they won't complain. I got 'oh, so sorry for the inconvenience". This is a typical response at this hotel. I had to push hard to get moved, but eventually we moved to the tenth floor. Total disrespect for guests; I can't believe that the hotel thought it was acceptable to expose paying guests to that level of noise. Do yourself a favour, there are countless better hotels in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ellysian
Reviews.Content: Short business stay in Sheraton on Scotts Road. Very disappointed with hotel and considering there only a few Singapore dollars between rates here and the St Regis, I will be staying elsewhere when inSingapore. First off I found the staff both friendly and efficient. Restaurants choice limited and the poor choice of foods at Executive Club almost laughable compared to other Sheratons or SPG hotels I have stayed The rooms are dated, and when I was there and despots complaints to management, the noise of building work flooded my room from 8:30 am to 7 pm.

Reviews.Title: “Still fine but ...”
Reviews.Author: tongi
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Sheraton Towers each year since 2007 and I continue to find the STAFF delightful - helpful, courteous and kind. I visit Singapore on business, and my room becomes my "home" for the time I'm there, which is sometimes a number of weeks. I spend a lot of time at the hotel, and use the spa, bar and restaurants. I like the atmosphere of this hotel - it's welcoming and comfortable, but not "flash" and glamorous. It DOES look and feel like a hotel that was built in the 1980s, so probably not great for people wanting a "cutting edge" city holiday experience or business travellers who expect premium international hotel standards. I LOVE the location of the Sheraton Towers - right near the Newton MRT station and on several bus routes. It's also good for taxis and an easy walk to Orchard Road. It's not the hotel's fault that it's been surrounded by construction sites for about three years, and the street-scape of Scotts Road certainly looks different to when I first stayed. But I do wish to raise some concerns: - WIFI is not free, which is not in keeping with international hotel standards - the public areas are comfortable but dated, and there's little change or variety in what they offer (YEAR to YEAR) - the breakfast, while generous, never changes (and I mean over the YEARS) - the presentation of the food in the main dining room is not of the standard I expect - I stayed in 2009 and I recall having the caesar salad was stylishly presented and looked great on the plate; this time is was a mound of heavily-dressed leaves in a bowl - the in-room TV offerings are poor and the free movie channels disappeared in the 2nd week I stayed - room phone calls are expensive - again out of keeping with modern hotel practice But I love - the big firm bed - the pleasant relaxed environment - the location - the STAFF and - the STAFF and again - the STAFF

Reviews.Title: “Good Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Vikrant11
