Reviews.Content: Good property with awesome facilities and amenities Staff is incredible. The service is outstanding I had a pleasant stay at the Sheraton Location is good. The hotel is impressive Located very closed to Orchard shopping district

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel but some front desk folks have an attitude”
Reviews.Author: Houston_Traveler55
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel is decent and inline with the reviews on the trip advisor. I paid cash and points so it was not too expensive, a rate of S$300 would be too much for what is provided. One of the front desk person who checked me in was kind of rude and not caring, we also stayed in Sheraton Kualumpur and Bangkok and the front desk experience was night and day difference.

Reviews.Title: “A good but tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: Searene10
Reviews.Content: The overall impression of the hotel when you first enter is quite impressive with a wonderful grand staircase on your left as you enter. The foyer and ground area is very nice. However the room we got was okay butstarting to look a bit tired. Actually it was somehwat dark in the room. Batroom was adequate but would not rave over it. The staff weer very attentive and pelasant but you get to expect that in SIngapore. The buffet dinner was okay but lacked variety and there was difficulty in getting to the food in the back of the warmers due to their placement. A lady next to em had to role up her dress sleeve so she di not get it in the food. The bar was great with very good singers and good staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: DakshDhawan
Reviews.Content: Dear All, This is a wonderful property in singapore. right at the heart of Singapore. A must stay for everyone. The facilities and the amenities are awesome. the staff is incredible very helpful. the food here is out of the world. the hospitality is the way it should be. i had a pleasant stay and you all people will also have. i am sure about it.

Reviews.Title: “A great nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: soniasrilanka
Reviews.Content: This full service hotel far exceeded our expectations. The rooms are modern and very comfortable. There is a beautiful waterfall in the main dining area that is a must see and makes your experience that much more memorable. Hotel offers top notch amenities and is located within walking distance to eating areas and the train station. Very friendly staff and prompt service.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive & has had it's day - long ago”
Reviews.Author: BernieDSC
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times and the only reason I keep going back is for my Starpoints. The only other Starwood property in Singapore is the St. Regis and that is far more expensive (but much nicer). The Sheraton Towers is woefully in need of a refurbishment. It must be the only 5 star hotel in the world with small, old CRT-type TVs (only a few rooms have flat panel TVs and some of those are old and small). The channel selection is abysmal and the reception is erratic. Only a couple of the top suites have DVD players. The rooms are old and not suitable for work - only a few rooms have ergonomic style work chairs at the desks - most have old dining room style chairs - very uncomfortable and no height adjustment. On the positive side, the hotel is very clean and the staff are nice. The gym is small but very good - beware, it is not a hotel gym and is run by a commercial company so when "members" arrive it is REALLY crowded. Out of peak hours it is fine. The Executive lounge is nice - but the selection for breakfast and cocktails is very limited. Be prepared to have someone pounce on you every time you enter the lounge asking for your room number. Given that entrance is controlled by your room key I fail to understand why they make such a big deal about establishing your room number. But my BIG complaint is the price. I recently had to pay SGD400++ - it was the cheapest rate available. For the standard of the rooms etc this is simply usury. The owners have failed to invest any money over the last 10 years, which the exception of refurbished elevators, which are now so dimly lit you can't even read the floor numbers or the signs. I have stayed in most of the premium suites (I'm a Platinum Member so get upgraded) - if I had to pay the full rate for these I would be VERY angry. There is absolutely nothing of interest around this hotel (condos and office blocks) but it is very close to an MRT station. Getting a taxi in the morning can be next to impossible and I have had a 45 minute wait standing in a long line on more than one occasion. Bottom line - the price is just not worth it and if you can stay elsewhere, then do so.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location but in need of serious renovation”
Reviews.Author: whoisthis
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 days in May because of a deal we got for starwood hotels. First, the good - the hotel is very convenient. It is less than 5 min walk from the Newton subway station, which will take you to Orchard, Raffles Place and other major sites without needing a transfer. Unfortunately, as many reviewers noted, the room is absolutely in need of some refurbishment. The carpet looks like it's from the 70's, the TV is small and old, and the hallways are all bright lights that hurt your eyes when you stepped off the dim elevator. Most of the bedside buttons were worn from use. The staff was nice enough and the room was kept clean. But I wouldn't come back if I have to pay standard rates.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Sheraton standards>”
Reviews.Author: Celticjo58
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights there last week. As many other reviewers have said the rooms are badly in need of a major renovation. From the small bathroom to the old TV the place needs a major revamp. The pool is very basic and needs a facelift. Nice pleasant staff but that is not enough to get me to return. Sorry Sheraton but you have just handed the Marriott a new customer.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay at the Sheraton Towers”
Reviews.Author: ZNasir
Reviews.Content: The hotel is like 15 minutes away from the Orchard Street. One can walk, take a taxi or the MRT which is also very close. The rooms are a little small and a bit outdated but are well maintainded. The housekeeping does thier job well and we found the rooms always cleaned when we returned. The breakfast is really well made with a lot of varity. The ambience is soft, natural and inviting a great thing to see early in the morning. Everyting is fresh may it be the fruits or the diffierent breads and there is always enough of everything for everyone. The staff is kind and polite and we had no hassles checking in or checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Blast from the past, not worth the price!”
Reviews.Author: Freezer-san
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed two nights at the Sheraton and was shocked at the state of the rooms. No changes in a least 20 years, oldest TV I have seen in a hotel for quite some time. Tough to get taxis, but close to the MRT. I will not return as there are newer, cheaper and better located options.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience Need renovation AsAp”
Reviews.Author: ebby84
Reviews.Content: staff not friendly and very old rooms with bad smell i dont recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Bad location, rundown facility”
Reviews.Author: IntBizTraveler
Reviews.Content: Difficult to get a cab. Staff not friendly. No wifi. Small gym. Rooms are old. Highly not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Dated and off the beaten path; you can do better in Singapore.”
Reviews.Author: cougrz007
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at this hotel as part of a longer business trip within Asia. I chose the hotel based on its participation in the SPG program and because of an attractive corporate rate. Check-in: Relatively fast and efficient. I arrived at 7:00am and was only able to get a room if I paid a full night's rate! Otherwise I was told I would have to wait until 10:00am. I understand that rooms may not be ready or the hotel may have a policy to make guests wait, but it seems petty to charge a full night's rate for a couple of extra hours. Not the best start at this hotel. Room: The rooms are this hotel are like a step into the 90s. Very dark, rather dated, and with an old TV and old bathroom fixtures. That said, the room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The shower had good water pressure. Amenities: The hotel has a nice gym facility, although it seemed to be crowded. The pool area is nice. I didn't have much trouble getting a taxi when needed (often times this is a problem in Singapore). The breakfast buffet was average - I've had better and also have had worse. I definitely would not pay the full asking price, but it was included in my room rate. I did take advantage of the laundry service a few times and the service provided was excellent. Location: The hotel is a 10-minute walk from Orchard Road, so not a terrible location. The MRT is right next door, with convenient service to the city center. There's also the Newton Circus Hawker Center within walking distance. The walk to Orchard Road was a bit tedious but otherwise not an issue. Overall Verdict: I probably wouldn't stay here again unless the hotel was renovated. Singapore is one of the great hotel cities in the world, and it's not worth it to stay at a dated property in an out-of-the-way location just for a few starwood points. On the same trip I also stayed at the Fairmont and the Ritz Carlton - both had comparable rates and were far superior to the Sheraton in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal business stay”
Reviews.Author: abhinavdhandia
Reviews.Content: For my short trips to Singapore, Sheraton has an excellent location though basic room infrastructure needs to be improved. I was given a room key that wouldnt fit into the card slot, but the staff was prompt to provide me with a replacement key. The hotel is a 2 minute walk from the MRT station and with that in place, Singapore is very accessible. I enjoyed my stay and will continue to be at the sheraton in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property - dated but really well kept and extremely clean”
Reviews.Author: SanAntonioFamily
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical of staying here based on some of the reviews, but the property was absolutely beautiful! Yes, it is dated, but it is kept up extremely well - so well, I didn't even care that it was dated. Also, another problem I have had in Asia is the hard beds. Since this is a western based hotel, the beds were great. They also have a controller (again looks old) that controls everything in the room - it was cool and I didn't care that it was old. Also, the staff is so wonderful!! I got caught in a cab with no Sing dollars and a cab driver that didn't take credit cards. The bellman immediately took care of it and transferred the bill to my room. Awesome!! Definetly would stay here again! (This is the first review I have ever written on this site, and I did so ONLY because I felt the other reviews were so misleading!)

Reviews.Title: “convenient location, dated facilities, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: taipa
Reviews.Content: I stay at this Sheraton all the time mainly because the SPG points are a great value here. This location is steps from the Newton MRT, and it is extremely easy to get a taxi here (versus LONG taxi queues on Orchard). There's also a 711 in the Newton MRT for convenient snacks and drinks. The rooms are definitely dated and the whole facility could use a facelift, but the bed and sheets are fresh and comfortable and that's whats most important. 5 stars for sleep quality. Service is good. Very positive interactions with doormen, housekeeping, and frontdesk. One bad feedback I have is that the $20/day Internet occasionally hangs and times out. I hope they fix it. As long as the SPG points continue to be a good value, I will keep staying here when I'm in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Charming stay Sheraton Towers, Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Nilanjan
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed an exceptional holiday at Singapore and it was because of the charming stay at Sheraton Towers, Singapore. The service at the hotel was exceptional, food was great and the hotel staff was always helpful and courteous. The hotel is easily accessible and is very conveniently located. My family loved this hotel !!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, dated rooms, slow Internet, somewhat overpriced”
Reviews.Author: subpardriver
Reviews.Content: Seems to be expensive for what you are getting. Rooms are a bit dated and over-furnished. Good bathrooms, slow Internet service.

Reviews.Title: “Dated Hotel with a generally good location”
Reviews.Author: maic
Reviews.Content: I had to spend a night in Singapore last minute. The hotel had weekend special at spg.com for S$240 including breakfast. I called the spg hotline and was told the front desk would be able to offer me the internet price so instead of trying to book online using an iphone while on the move, I took at axi to the hotel. Surprise, the walk in rate was $300. However, I was welcome to use the business center computer to book online to get the $240 rate, which I did. Once booked, the hotel's computers were updated immediately and I could check-in. This is a old hotel that has very much a share of life experiences of Singaporeans. My friend first got to know his future wife on a first date there many years ago. I attended many university balls there as well in the early 90s. The room I had was decent sized. The bed was very comfortable and consistent with other sheratons in asia. The shower had good pressure and hot water, and had nice amenities (not the Sheraton OEM stuff you get in some of the other hotels). Internet was chargeble, but you could easily get a microsim at the airport for S$20 for your ipad with a 30day validity and 1GB data size. Breakfast was at the lobby coffee house. It had the usual spread, but was not as great compared to some of the other Sheraton like the one in Bangkok or Laguna in Bali. However it was 3 mins walk to the MRT, and just outside of the busy CBD. On the whole, a old hotel, stayable if the rates are good.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel but very dated rooms”
Reviews.Author: superstardj
Reviews.Content: Hotel is generally good, with good communal areas and a decent pool and gym, but rooms are sadly dated. I was in a Towers room, which is exactly the same as a normal room except you get various extras, like access to the Executive Lounge and 6 (or so) items of free laundry a day. I did miss having 'Club Rooms' which you get in many normal Sheratons and are a nice middle between a standard room and a suite. Whilst these little 'Towers' extras were much appreciated (the executive lounge is great), a refresh of the rooms would go a long way. They're very dated and this really lets the place down, and until the rooms have had a refresh, I'd probably not return.

Reviews.Title: “Central and Top”
Reviews.Author: mba4u
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of the city along Scotts Road, the Sheraton Towers Singapore is famous for warm and accommodating service. Just a short distance away from the Newton Circus – the outdoor food court and the renowned Orchard Road shopping and entertainment district. Public transport (MRT/SBS) is close by. The rooms a traditional furnished and have all what you need in a 5***** hotel. The outdoor pool offers to cool off after a long day of shopping or exploration. The brand new Towers Executive lounge is now open, offering discerning guests a plush lounge experience with floor-to-ceiling glass windows for an unrivaled view. And the food is there excellent as well as the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “It had it's days”
Reviews.Author: KT785
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as the St Regis was fully booked. This hotel was something of an icon in the early 1990s - see my photo of it's Wall of Fame at the reception, showing its awards which show it managed to win the Best Hotel Award in 1992-93. The hotel has the distinction of a curved screen CRT TV (with a missing cover for its controls) - this may worth seeing in hyper-modern Singapore. It also has a quaint, economical, shower that will be bettered by most YMCAs. It is about a 10 minute walk from Orchard Road in a drab location along Scotts Road, but it has an MRT station a 3 minute walk away - its saving grace. It has somewhat professional (apparently local, not immigrant - like in many other 4-5 star Orchard Road hotels) front line staff who were professional, courteous and confident - somethning of a gift nowadays when hotels nearby have inept staff or brash, condescending, or matter-of-fact, ones. But I wouldn't sing praises - I got no welcome gift/amenity whatsoever (e.g. upgraded room, welcome fruit basket etc etc) beyond the "late checkout when available". You would survive this hotel - do take it if you get a good deal - you are likely to still find rooms here even if most Orchard Road hotels have run out of non-suite rooms, but if you find a better hotel within a S$50 strike price, you will be glad to have spent that S$50. But if want to reminisce about how hotels looked like in 1990, (it is almost like visiting a museum) stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Location”
Reviews.Author: travel_turtle123
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because I was able to use SPG points and cash to book a room for 3 nights. Overall experience was fine, had a room on a high floor with a view of the pool. Size of the room was good and clean, and bed was very comfortable. It was really hot while we were there, so we made really good use of the pool at night after dinner which was very refreshing to have. Close walk to Newton food court with a wide selection of food and really inexpensive. The concierge was friendly, had helped me book my dinner reservation on night. Took the shuttle bus(not expensive) from the hotel to the Zoo. Took taxi to the Botanical Gardens. Never really had any issues with hailing a taxi from the hotel. All the staff was pleasant enough.

Reviews.Title: “Old... but great service.”
Reviews.Author: gillianginny
Reviews.Content: I was checked in by a new staff who asked a wrong deposit amount. My room was $265 (net) per night and i had made payment in advance. She asked $350 deposit for my one night stay and when i asked her how come the deposit amount is higher than my room rate, she couldn't answer me.. my question was overheard by another senior staff at the front desk and he came over to check and realized that she had asked for a wrong amount. The actual deposit required was $100 only.. that senior staff apologized but that 'newbie' never even say a sorry for her mistake.. The senior was really helpful.. he asked my friend and i if we need anything and he will do his best to get it for us.. We're glad to had him to serve us after that.. Our propose of that day was to relax .. laying on the Sweet Sleeper bed and watch our favourite TV shows .. but, when i went in to my room, I was shocked to see their bed and TV.. the bed is small and it is totally different from Sweet Sleeper i had at the other Sheratons or Four Points.. My advise to those who want/will to stay here, never expect a plasma TV in your room.. I'm not too sure if i want to stay in Sheraton Singapore again.. will have to think twice before book it...

Reviews.Title: “It's your typical Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Lizarazu20
Reviews.Content: Room: Average Sheraton room, it has everything you need. The TV was really old, and had a poor selection of channels. The shower was a combo bath/shower, which is not what you expect given it’s a Sheraton and the price. No WIFI in the room. Rating: (3/5) Staff: We used the concierge for tips on where to find souvenirs and specific food. They were good enough. Rating: (3/5) Facilities: They have a pool, and fitness room. We used the shower facilities to freshen up before heading off to the airport for a midnight flight. Rating: (3.5/5) Location: The hotel is about 2 minutes walk from the Newton MRT. It’s about a 10-minute walk to the Newton food centre. Orchard Road is a 10-minute walk, or one stop on the MRT. Rating: (3.5/5)

Reviews.Title: “Average Sheraton - look at other options.”
Reviews.Author: Gautam73
Reviews.Content: Hi, We stayed for 5 nights at the Sheraton Towers in Singapore. I would rate this is a very average hotel - the property is dated and needs refurbishment. The location is ok - a 10 - 15 min walk from Orchard. I would not recommend this hotel. I would recommend that people look at other 5 star options.

Reviews.Title: “my 2nd unfavourable review of a Sheraton this week”
Reviews.Author: numberoneson
Reviews.Content: USD300 a night and there is a Panasonic TV (CRT type) from when they first opened the hotel in my room, this in high-tech Sing, a big joke. in the Club Lounge this morning they had some crap pastries from machine mixed dough that wre half stale. many selections of hotels here in Sing, this was a lame one, poor value

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel - with a couple of issues”
Reviews.Author: BCtraveler44
Reviews.Content: We booked a towers room. Yikes expensive. Decent room. Regular room as far as I could tell (we had a huge upgrade to a suite at the Crowne Plaza earlier in the trip). The lounge access was a blessing. Cold drinks available throughout the day. Early closure of 11 PM. Having 8 pieces of laundry per day as part of the room in the Singapore climate was a god send. Avoid the spa. Decent appetizers at night. Limited breakfast in the morning. Lounge was never crowded. You could choose breakfast in the lounge or the dining area. On our last morning we had problems with the breakfast. Al least 2 buses of school teams that over ran the capacity of the restaurant and made our start to a very long day not the best. The omelet station was not even going by 6:45 AM. All food was stripped clean. Normally when hotels have groups like this they have a separate room for them. Our day ended 26 hours later in Vancouver. I may stay here again with some reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Overly priced and not”
Reviews.Author: zareerk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is overpriced and not good value for money. I am usually a big fan of the SPG hotels but was disappointed with this experience. I had asked for a room for early check-in which was not provided (though they are not obliged to do this for me). The toiletries provided are virtually zilch (not even a toothbrush) just some ear buds and a shower cap. The bathroom fittings are not in the best condition and the mini refrigerator's door creaked. The breakfast spread is good and that is quite frankly the only good thing about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, great people”
Reviews.Author: HKAIR
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel; the employees have been working there forever and is always nice to see familiar faces when you check in. I arrived very early in the morning (6 am flight from Zurich) and was pleasantly surprised to find a room ready for me. The only problem I had was with the AC in the room, it leaked overnight and it soaked the carpet in the hallway (took me a while to figure out why my sleepers kept getting wet). Once I reported the problem it was fixed quickly and the follow-up was great. The breakfast buffet is good, for me the highlight were the freshly squeezed juices. Orchard Rd is just 10 min walk or a stop by the metro and the taxi from the airport is less than 20 SGD. And the best of the best- Newton Hawker Centre is 3 min away. If you have time- check out the new Marina Bay Sands- it is a cool building and it offers a great view from the top on a clear day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - My experience was great!”
Reviews.Author: mgerardlee
Reviews.Content: Based on some of the previous reviews, I wasn't expecting much. But after staying here for two days, I wonder if I am staying at the same place as all the negative reviewers. My room was well appointed - old world - but well appointed, immaculately clean and in great shape. The staff has been really excellent. Breakfast was very good. The Chinese restaurant very recommended by a native and really good. Laundry was well-done. I have stayed at the Mandarin Oriental in KL, The Sheraton in KL, The Meridian in Ankor Wat and the Sheraton in Bangkok - all different styles but the Sheraton Singapore compares favourably. Its 10 minutes walking from Orchard Road....it wasn't that out of the way. It is definitely a 4.5 star hotel - not quite a 5 star but still very good nonetheless and I didn't experience any of the negative things I read in the other reviews. In any case, it was a very nice place for a business trip and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to a friend or family. As for the internet access.....it's the same price as any 4-5 star hotel I have stayed at in North America, Europe or Asia in the past year.

Reviews.Title: “traditional good old service”
Reviews.Author: Breamo
Reviews.Content: first time in this hotel and stayed for a week. Hotel is north of orchad road and is a few minutes away from the MRT station. Check in no problems and was well looked after with someone taking my luggage up and showing me the room. Initially the internet won't work and has to called room service. Apparently router needed to be reset. However, there is no wireless service so mobility is restricted with a LAN cable. Tried out the gym a couple of time which is good. Plenty of staff around to provide assistance if it needed to be. Second half of my stay sign up for the executive package where it included access to lounge facilities, free laundry and breakfast room service and plus a few other things I didn't use and cannot remember. In room breakfast is always on time and it is nicely done. And the buffet breakfast is also qutie good. No sure if I will sign up in the future as apart from room service and free laundry, I tend not to use the other goodies. Overall felt that the hotel room needs a bit of upgrade. The TV is still the old type CRT unit. The rate is relatively expensive. So I would not recommend that to a friend, there are better places to stay for leisure.

Reviews.Title: “yeah ok its a bit old but its comfortable and feels like home.”
Reviews.Author: Gheringhap92
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Towers Singapore is a great place to base your self in Singapore. The hotel is located next to the MRT (Subway)which is easy to use and gets you to every where you need to go. There is an AMAZING hawker style food market across the road.... if you love food, you will love this place. You have to try the sting ray. Stylish shopping is around the corner on Orchard and lets not forget you are in one of the amazing cities of the word! Staff at the hotel are friendly and very helpful, the rooms are clean, room service is fast and the beds are sweet to sleep in..... what more could you ask for... I'll be back soon I hope.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok”
Reviews.Author: sabos93
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Towers Singapore is a perfectly nice hotel that nonetheless feels a little off. I could never shake the feeling that for what I was paying as a business traveller ($300 SGD), that I should be receiving better value. The food was generally ok but usual bland and unappealing. The fruits and juices were not always fresh. The restaurants lacked any flair and felt like hotel restaurants. And the hotel's WiFi always required a call to their help desk just to get it working. Also, the location isn't really great if you want to do anything other than shop. On the plus slide, the service was always good and the room were clean. So, in summary, a fine hotel for what it is but I would not chose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We were happy with the Sheraton Towers”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi-Frequent-Flier
Reviews.Content: After reading all the dreadfully negative reviews on Tripadvisor, I was dreading staying at the Sheraton Towers in Singapore with my family. I am an SPG Platinum member, and had booked two rooms (King and Twin) on Cash & Points, for two nights, passing through Singapore on longhaul flights. After reading the reviews, I had forewarned my wife to expect a very tired shabby hotel, poor service, inconvenient location, etc. I am happy to report I didn't find any of these things. Admittedly, being Platinum, I was upgraded into one of their 22 signature suites, (which are intriguingly each furnished individually in the style of a different famous world city). My children had a nearby standard twin room. Both of our rooms were perfectly adequate, well supplied, clean and presentable. Everything that was supposed to be in them appeared to be, and there was nothing that stood out as being particularly tatty, old or in disprepair. Nothing appeared stained or dirty. The rooms were smallish - as is common in hotels in Singapore. The standard online price for them seemed very ballpark (5 star accommodation in Singapore is universally overpriced). We ate in the Executive Lounge on the 3rd floor, which was spacious, nicely detailed and comfortable, and had a small but adequate continental breakfast in the morning, and a reasonably good cocktail hour. The pool area on 5th floor is pretty basic in keeping with the older age of the hotel - but I have seen a lot worse. The gym next to the pool looked well equipped. The ground floor and basement restaurants looked inviting. There is a nice al-fresco outdoor dining area on the ground floor that is amid full sized palm trees and a high waterfall cascading down rocks which was a nice feature. The hotel is about a 10-15 minute walk up Scotts Street from Orchard Road, but is very close to the Newton Circus Hawker food market, and is also directly next door to the Newton underground MRT station on the NorthSouth line, so the next three stations are all Orchard Road shopping, etc. Taxis to most central city locations were very inexpensive. While you can't step out of the hotel into the middle of a major shopping precinct, I didn't feel the location was inconvenient at all. My only annoyance was the fact that they had an understaffed reception desk, no SPG desk, and the Exec Lounge couldn't handle checkin/checkout. This meant that there was often a queue at the reception area - a hassle checking in and checking out. Taxis could also be difficult to get at different times of the day - but that is also very typical for Singapore. All of the staff I dealt with were friendly and helpful however. There is no doubt that this hotel could do with a spruce up. The outside area around the pool is dated, hallways are bland, but having stayed in many different hotels in Singapore over the years, I had no complaints and would not have a problem staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Over Priced & Over Rated”
Reviews.Author: GPDCanberra
Reviews.Content: Location OK, however rooms very tired and shabby. Room service quick , food terrible. Ironing Boards are too low and poorly padded. Hairdryers totally useless for styling purposes. Internet over priced, considering the rate for rooms this should be free. This hotel is in need of a total overhaul. Considering the location it needs to revamp prices downward, better located & quality properties can be found for less $$$.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, poor location”
Reviews.Author: rex_lucent
Reviews.Content: Top Notch room, huge room footprint, comfortable, spacious..eveything that you would expect from a better hotel in Singapore. They charge you $20 SNG per day for internet service which really makes a lasting......negative impression. While the hotel is very nice, the location is rather poor. Nothing near by except for the MRT. Avoid the night-time food court near the MRT as they appear to practice the use of two sets of menus. One for the locals and one for the tourists! Good place for a conference or if you are only going to/from office. Poor choice for tourists

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - but little old”
Reviews.Author: sportler
Reviews.Content: Really a nice hotel with a great location in Singapore. Very nice excecutive lounge with small but nice breakfast. Very nice fitness studio with state-of-the-art equipment. Really enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel with great service, needs a few tweaks for perfection”
Reviews.Author: Windmills4ever
Reviews.Content: I stayed here Grand Prix week on an unrelated business trip, so it was pricey, but actually cheaper than most alternatives. The service was excellent, particularly from the chaps at front of house, helping me with directions, getting cabs and generally making me feel like a welcome guest. I found the room very comfortable, although was in a twin and the beds were a little narrow. The bathroom was excellent and the bath a nice place to soak away the days stresses and strains. Aside from the bed size, the only amendment I would suggest would be to upgrade the TV/entertainment system. As it happens I was out most evenings on this trip, but on other business travel quite often I would make use of this facility. The TV here was small and couldn't be seen well from either bed. Also, there was no "on-demand" system for more entertainment options. I ate once in the "Lei Bei" restaurant, which was excellent. Breakfast was comprehensive, although I was wolfing it down every morning running late for meetings thanks to the the jetlag disruption. I used the pool/gym for a full exercise session twice during my 4-day trip and found both to be excellent. There were no staff at the bar during one of my visits to the pool, which was odd as it was lunchtime. However there had been heavy rain not long before I got in, so that must have been the reason. Also, I was the only one in there. Overall a very comfortable hotel, that I would highly recommend. Close to all the major sights and next to a MRT station. Cabs are cheap anyway in Singapore, nowhere is more than a few £s a way.

Reviews.Title: “Old, dusty, worn out absolutely overpriced”
Reviews.Author: AGADOTTI
Reviews.Content: Arrived late at night, I usually use Starwoods hotels around the world, but this Sheraton was big time disappointment. Rooms are old, probably they do not refurbish since 20 years, and the price is the same of what you pay at the Marina Bay Sands that is a great hotel. I stayed 10 minutes on the phone before speaking with the front desk and all the rooms he showed me around are the same old worn out dusty stuff. The room smells OLD and dust and my colleague has also mold inside. Absolutely a shame for a Starwood Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very expensive but worth it; old but in very good condition.”
Reviews.Author: PopeyeCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I had to stay for an overnight and arrived after midnight. I had to leave the next day very early. This hotel was perfectly organized, the check-in, the rooms, the breakfast. The only minor problems I encountered concerned the light switch for the bathroom which I couldn't find and the dashboard next to my bed which was old and need of replacement. Yet the whole hotel is totally luxurious which might be normal in Asia but a quality of which you wouldn't so easily find in Europe. And I liked the old style which exhumed a kind of solid hospitality of the old-fashioned kind. All in all it wasn't cheap but I guess I couldn't have had a better sleep.

Reviews.Title: “a bit dated. needs an upgrade, and the staff uniforms?? long pants around the pool!!??”
Reviews.Author: gl0ryb0y
Reviews.Content: the hotel needs a bit of an upgrade. a bit old world and stayed. housekeeping needs a bit of a shake in public areas. especially the a/c ducts in the all day dining area. the staff uniforms are very dated. long pants in the pool bar?? (i believe the current gm has put this into place) maybe he needs to get out more. overall the staff were very friendly and attentive. the location is a bit out of the norm shopping districts. but overall the bar and the clientell were much more up market than raffles. what a waste of time that place was. and so yobbo. stay at the sheraton..

Reviews.Title: “SO BAD. DIDN'T LIKE IT”
Reviews.Author: Elisavil
Reviews.Content: I was very very disappointed by this hotel, considering it is supposed to be high level. It should not be part of the Starwood group anymore. Nice lobby and that' all. The rooms (I have tried too) are old stile, not ancient, just old. No amenities in, not even the hanger for the towel in the bathroom. It is totally not children friendly. The only nice person was a receptionist. We even cancelled the reservation for 1 night on 2 and the day after they were wondering why we were leaving! They didn't take note of our changes. I have booked asking for a crib and when I was there the crib wasn't yet in the room. Then, after one hour, they arrived with a BED, not a crib. During dinner, the waiters spent their time texting messages on their mobile and taking pictures! It was unbeliavable. I think they should train their people better and change totally their rooms, as they do not respect the "supposed" level of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sailors on westpack”
Reviews.Author: CarlosAlanis
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with a bunch of my friends and I liked it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kmabello
Reviews.Content: Sheraton is a very good business hotel to stay in: 1) Location is PERFECT -- Hotel is two minutes walk to/from the Newton MRT station. 2) Rooms are spacious and comfortable. The amenities are good, and the hotel just gives a lot of extra services to make you incredibly comfortable (8 pieces of free laundry a day... what more can I say?) 3) Service is amazing. The staff is courteous and helpful. If you give them a call for whatever need you have, the response is always quick. 4) View is amazing :) I guess my only comment about this place is that it is pricey. I wouldn't recommend this for people on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Nice lobby and ground floor facilities, but outdated rooms and pricey services”
Reviews.Author: Hitch71
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a couple with one 3 yrs old child for 3 nights. We got a good offer thru SPG membership which did not include breakfast. Breakfast is just so expensive at this hotel and you can feed a family outside the hotel for the price of one in the hotel. The swimming pool was also boring and small. However the staff were all very friendly and helpful and there was live music in the lobby bar at night which was appreciated. The real problem with the whole place is prices, bit expensive for average quality.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Wifi service”
Reviews.Author: jenjacknick
Reviews.Content: Hi I have just returned from a 1 week business trip to Singapore. The check in went well and my room was lovely. We were holding meetings on a daily basis in the hotle and all 10 of my colleagues had signed up for the weekely WIFI service at 107SGD each. But we found that this did not work in the board room, or that the connection dropped out. The staff were very attentive at getting us back on but this was a real pain. The breakfast at the hotel was fab. The location i thought was fine, straight across the raod from the mrt and a 10 minute walk to Orchard rd.

Reviews.Title: “Very tired and overpriced for the room quality”
Reviews.Author: Charleyquant
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here over 10 years ago I was very surprised to find it in exactly the same state as it was in the mid 90's. The room furniture, bedding and fixtures are just tired and look pretty shabby now....and checking in and out took forever with only 2 people on the front desk at 7pm at night and 8.30 am when there was at least 8-10 people trying to check in and out. Although there is nothing fundamentally wrong with the hotel the price for value of the experience is way too high at SGD 370. I have paid far less for much better quality hotels in Singapore so would not go back to this hotel. For Starwood guests there also aren't starwood preferred floors - i did complain to the manager who simply told me that they were going to be renovated at the end of the year.

Reviews.Title: “run down”
Reviews.Author: fivestarholidays
Reviews.Content: Sheraton at singapore was known for its excellent butler service and very efficient staff. I was a regular at this hotel and in the last 3-4 years have seen its standards drop. I will not use this hotel again. it needs a total makeover. The lobby and other public spaces look worn out n uncared for. The service is average and the rooms aged. Maybe its the lighting but overall this hotel is a pale shadow of its glorious days.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good hotel, great for a business stopover”
Reviews.Author: Atyanand
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean, quiet and comfortable rooms. Excellent location just a couple of minutes from Orchard Street. If you are travelling on work, then this is a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but a bit of a letdown compared to other Sheraton hotels”
Reviews.Author: Akhilesh09
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the hotel is its location. Its situated on Scotts road, about 10 mins walk from Orchard Road, Singapore's premier shopping destination. But the hotel hasn't properly leveraged its great location. Food is just ok, rooms are average sized, interiors not really lavish and you don't get the feel that you are staying in a Sheraton property. Having said that, it doesn't mean that you won't have a pleasant stay. You will. But for the price it charges, there are much better options in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, hotel needs an update”
Reviews.Author: mikezens
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton is located on Scotts Road, next to an MRT station, so you can easily access all of Singapore. With a 15min walk, you will also reach the main shopping street in Singapore 'Orchard Road'. Problem is, that directly next to the hotel is no 711 or any other small shop, so if you want to bring some drinks (prices in the hotel are high), so need to think of this ahead of time and bring from the city. I booked a suite, which was good, as we stayed in Singapore for 17nights. A normal room would have been somewhat small, if you stay for a longer period. The design of the room is rather conservative. A lot of dark would. Something you also find in a lot of hotels in the US. Not my taste, as I like modern design better. Being a SPG PLatinum member I was entitled to use the Executive Lounge, which I did for breakfast. Breakfast selection is limited, but service very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Old style rule-bound Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Ozziepore
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs to lift its game. I arrived on an overnight flight and was exhausted. I was teaching night classes so needed to get some sleep during the day. Both days i was there I was woken by the housekeeping staff trying to get me out of the room so that they could make the bed. I was incredulous! I had the do not disturb sign on the door. Despite that, on day one they knocked on the door continuously and when i ignored them, they phoned me!! I was so angry, I rang and complained but it obviously had no effect whatsoever because exactly the same thing happened the next day. I phoned and complained to the duty manager, got some pleasantries and then 'so would you like somone to come in and do your room now madam?'. I nearly imploded. Clearly their only concern is to meet their regulation amount of bed-making and no idea of customer comfort. The customer's needs and eccentricities don't matter, the rules do (although I wouldn't imagine that daytime sleeping in a hub of global travel was all that eccentric). My suggestion, put do not disturb on the door and also ring and ask the operator to put a DND on the phone. I wouldn't know if it worked the third day because by then I had moved hotels. Yes Sheraton, when you are working it's the little things that matter - like sleep.

Reviews.Title: “7 Star Price for 1 Star Service”
Reviews.Author: kichristag
Reviews.Content: I am Platinum member of SPG, but this hotel is a shame for the SPG Group. Very high prices, lousy service. Upgradede to a Cabana room i was very dispappointed. Small and old unpractical room and a very old television with a few programs and very bad picture and this for nearly 400 SGD per day. If you on teh working table, nobody can pass behind. The location is not bad, but this is the onliest positive thing to tell. Even during Football worldchampionship there is no football transmission in the room (even small 2 and 3 star hotels had football in the room. After complaining, not even an answer received. An urgent Fax was lost (received by the hotel, but never forwarded to me). In the lounge, every day the brackfast exactly the same food and not a lot of diffeerent variation. really a hotel where you should never stay, unless you want to pay triple money for less service.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChickenR
Reviews.Content: would recommend this hotel. it's close to orchard road and pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine”
Reviews.Author: LIVEINHOuSTON
Reviews.Content: SPG platinum...not upgraded. If you book a room with two single beds, keep in mind they are very small single beds. As soon as I walked into the room and realized how small the beds were, the lobby called to ask how I liked the room. I think they suspected I wouldn't like how small the beds were (they are single beds, not like two queen beds in the U.S. or in other countries). They moved me to another floor with a king, and facing the garden/pool (even numbered room) versus odd number facing the city. I arrived in SIN at 130A and the cab cost $25SGD...less than I expected. The ride took about 20/25 minutes. Taxis are very very inexpensive. The MRT (Newton) and bus stop are a 1 minute walk away. The breakfast in the exec lounge is great...eggs, breakfast meats, tomato, cereal, pastry, fresh squeezed orange juice. Had dinner at restaurant downstairs and the price was fair and meal was very tasty (had western food - salad/salmon/dessert). No other restaurants around the corner, you'd need to take a cab, but they are really cheap... I would stay here again; it's not the nicest Sheraton in Asia and hasn't been renovated in a long time, but it's good enough. And staff has been very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Well located Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Umski
Reviews.Content: About a mile away from Orchard Rd. it's a great hotel with brilliant landscaping. The MRT is barely 100 mts. away and bus stop right across. Virtually every bus stops at Orchard Rd. Sadly no "link" on the premises.

Reviews.Title: “nothing special”
Reviews.Author: plasticintruder
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Towers for three nights; the staff were somewhat apathetic, and I wasn't given a particularly desirable room, but the hotel was perfectly adequate for a short stay. The hotel is well located just steps from the metro station and a short walk from Orchard Road. The rooms are large and clean with most of the amenities expected of this class of hotel, but the decor and old TV are showing their age. Floor to ceiling windows let in a lot of light and room views are nice. Based on the rate I paid and the countless other options in the city I probably would not recommend this hotel to others. Compared to other Sheraton properties in Asia, this one does not stand out.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Biyani
Reviews.Content: The perfect business hotel in Singapore, well situated and has everything on hand. Rooms are not the best in Singapore but are clean and very well equipped. The staff are very efficient and helpful. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Value in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: JanRostkowski
Reviews.Content: Unbeatable value at SGD 215 / night, nice location, walk to Newton Circus hawker centre (local food). Very friendly + helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: manu100
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the sheraton singapore 30th dec to 2nd jan 2009/2010 the hotel is not as expected full of coach trip tourists, many children running around even in the towers. impossible to use the computers, due to children hoarding them, staff attitude poor, everything appeared to be an effort for them. would we stay again, no.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: Biyani
Reviews.Content: Overall I would like to say excellent!! The staffs are very polite and very friendly and they are very helpful at all the time. The breakfast is superb and also the restaurants. I will definitely consider it for my future stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: CIVOG
Reviews.Content: The hotel doesn't really have any "wow" factor, but it was nice to go to the room after a "hard" and intense day of sightseeing! The room was not particularly large, but it was roomy enough and nicely decorated! I liked a lot the central control of all lights and the digital sign "don't disturb" at the room door! We can see that we are in the technological Singapore! The breakfast was great and the fact that we could seat (if there was an available table) just besides the waterfall (on the other side of the window) was nice!

Reviews.Title: “Something is missing”
Reviews.Author: Deejaypea
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel on many occasions and though my preference is the Grand Hyatt, I keep trying the Sheraton because I feel I ought to enjoy it more than I do. The rooms are clean, nicely decorated and well equipped. The open bar is a good place to relax with live music in the evening. The coffee shop overlooking the beautiful man made waterfall serves a wonderful buffet breakfast and good quality a-la-carte in the evenings. The Italian restaurant is excellent. Service is efficient though a little cold and impersonal. The only fair criticism I can make is that its location is a little remote - though there is the MRT option nearby. So why don't I enjoy it more? Something is missing. That 'je ne sais quoi'

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: IK9
Reviews.Content: We would stay here again but would first look for a better hotel for the same price. Paid £120-130 per room. Cant really complain.

Reviews.Title: “They need to try harder”
Reviews.Author: nicolelachica
Reviews.Content: The poolside was great. The room with two full sized beds was a bit small and old. When I asked for a better room I was shown almost similar ones. The hotel was not crowded at all so they could have accommodated my request and perhaps gotten a better review. Singaporeans tend to be rather inflexible and should try harder to make their guest comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jcjcjcjcjcjcjc
Reviews.Content: About what you would expect from the Sheraton...exemplary service, above-average rooms, good business services. Nothing extraordinary like the Ritz, but a solid business hotel. The location was a bit out of the way if you are looking for the Quays, but I was on a business trip, so it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good food,clean room,nice pool,good services”
Reviews.Author: diawux
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near the MRT station , not far from Orchard street .It has a very nice pool at the 5 floor , gym and sauna .The dinner is very nice , breakfast good , services ok .

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but pricey”
Reviews.Author: wizbet
Reviews.Content: Been staying here for my business trips ever since the Starwood group closed the Le Meridien on Orchard. As a starwood member, the choice is now either Sheraton or the more unaffordable St Regis. Each trip, I will attempt to look for the best available rate via spg.com or the hotel's direct website. Best rate I've come across is SDG 200++ but this is room only rate (without breakfast) on a weekend. Weekday rate is RM 320++ (you're lucky if sometimes they throw in breakfast). Anyhow, room is basic & comfortable. Reception & housekeeping staff are friendly enough but service staffs at the restaurant (coffee house) are not at all. The hostess does not appear friendly at all & inspite of staying at least 4 nights on each trip, the hostess can't manage a smile of even a friendly hello. We actually stay here at least 3 times a year. Actually come to think of it, only the doorman & concierge recognises us. Having stayed here for the last 2 years, we only discovered that the gym operates on 24 hour basis. Access is only by room key card altough working out at night can be a little creepy as no one is there to assist to turn up the dimmed lights and no towel or water provided. We had to search around for headphones to hook up to the machines for TV /music. The swimming pool right outside the gym is quite small & old fashioned. Not very enticing - in fact we don't see many people at the pool. Car Park is free for guest which is a plus point. Another is the Newton Food Centre which is within walking distance. The MRT stop is right next to the hotel which is very convenient. Overall, it's quite a decent stay but not much value for the weekday rates.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Tintin0822
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great & it's near the SMRT station, bus/taxi stop & above all it's very near to the Orchard road where you can find a lot of goodies. :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly acceptable business hotel”
Reviews.Author: kzhang
Reviews.Content: I don't really know where all the complaints about this hotel are from! Sure, it's not right in the middle of bars/restaurants. Sure, the rooms don't have flat screens. Sure, the decor isn't inspiring. But it is clean, the service is good, and the rooms are comfy. I liked the location. It wasn't in the noisy hubbub, but it was right next to (literally a 1 minute walk) to a subway station, which can take you anywhere you'd want to go. It's also only a 5 minute walk to the Newton Food Centre. The rooms are very standard Asian Sheraton - not flashy, but clean with comfortable beds and sheets. I don't know why people complain that the decor is boring. It is, but if you want unique decor, go to a boutique hotel, or at least a St. Regis or Four Seasons. I really don't think Sheraton is ever known for having amazing decor. I also didn't find any weird smells, and the construction next door had finished when I was there, so it was very quiet. My one complaint is that the room service food was terrible! Really bland, uninspiring breakfast foods and equally bland desserts.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Keera03
Reviews.Content: I would recommend the Sheraton Towers to anyone. The service was exceptional, from the front desk, to the room service, to house keeping. I think this is a great hotel for business travellers, in that it is off the beaten path and located in a prett quite area. The rooms are clean, pretty spacious and the beds are very comfortable. The pool is a nice size and gets a lot of sun. I have stayed at this hotel multiple times on business travel 2-3 weeks at a time and there is nothing I would complain about.

Reviews.Title: “This is not like the other Sheratons”
Reviews.Author: rajeshkk
Reviews.Content: I dont know why, but this Sheraton property just does not match up to the others. From the location - not really part of mainstream Singapore, with no shooping, restaurants or night life near - to the lobby, which is hardly impressive. The corridors and rooms have an unique smell that is bad, the rooms are not well lit and poorly equipped (CRT TVs!). The bathrooms are small and really badly equipped. Given the Sheraton brand I do expect better from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: nileshreddy
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is amazing. very close to orchard road and the CBD. the rooms are well appointed and service was really good. The over all experince at the hotel was great and will not regret staying there..

Reviews.Title: “needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: mitr
Reviews.Content: Needs renovation. Food was decent.

Reviews.Title: “What a Let Down !”
Reviews.Author: zubind11
Reviews.Content: As an SPG member i decided to stay at Sheraton Towers even though i prefer staying on Orchard Rd. From the time i stepped in it was totally un-SPG like. The lady who checked me in gave me a room at monrning 10.30 and made it sound like a big deal (being early to their regular check-in hours) The hotel hasnt been renovated for ages (25 yrs or so). The carpets were smelly. Only decent thing was they allowed me an extended check-out. Very disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Binzad
Reviews.Content: Excellent Business Hotel, was there during the christmas season. Lovely Ambience very close to the Newton MRT. Good rooms and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: Lovingagoodholiday
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for two nights as a stop over on the way home from London. Quite a nice room. Large comfortable bed, large bathroom and all the usual amenities of a five star hotel. We were on a high floor that overlooked the swimming pool and general greenery. It's a shame that the view at the rear on the right, is now half-obscured by a new high-rise aparment block. The front of the building also has building works directly opposite. It's not too far from Orchard Road (main shopping), and an $8 to $15 taxi ride to Raffles for a Singapore Sling! (Depends on which taxi driver you get.) We dined in two of the restaurants. The Italian was nice but the wine was very expensive. We were only told after paying the bill that we were entitled to a discount as guests. That was annoying. In the main dining room we enjoyed excellent service (to the point of embarrassment) and reasonable food. The wine again was expensive. Breakfast was terrible. Cold Cold Cold! Ended up having coffee and toast. For a stopover it was an okay stay but at $513 a night I would perhaps try something different next time.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for business, but not on par with other SG hotels”
Reviews.Author: jarocha914
Reviews.Content: I knew something was up when one of my Singapore contacts asked, "why are you staying at the Sheraton? Was nothing else available?" It was a nice place to stay, but is not on par with other Singapore Hotels I've been (Millineum, Four Season and Marriott ). The Sheraton's location is a long walk from Orchard Road, but close to the Newton subway station. The fitness center is nice and overlooks the pool. Breakfast at the restaurant was good, but my ceasar salad at dinner was horrible. The hotel restaurants are pricey and there is nothing in walking distance. Take a cab to Boat Quay or River front for a nice meal. I would stay here again, on business, as a backup option.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: hydepark
Reviews.Content: What this hotel lacks, it makes up by providing exceptional service. I have stayed here a number of times mainly because I am an SPG member. But I have also been impressed by the good service. This time, service was first class. When I booked this hotel, I requested a high-floor room overlooking Scotts Road. In all my previous visits, I was given a room in the back of the hotel. The views from there weren't all that interesting, and faced a construction site. This time, I had a room with an unobstrucive view of the Scotts/Cairnhill skyline and busy Scotts Road traffic. Front desk confirmed on check-in that they had received my requests and were able to accommodate them. Everyone at the hotel was so courteous and helpful, the bellman took my luggage from the taxi and brought it up to my room, and described all the facilities in the hotel and in my room, like he was so proud to be working there. Also, the hotel is so close to the Newton MRT station, which is only a stop away from Orchard Road and is nowhere as crowded as Orchard MRT.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business, good for leisure”
Reviews.Author: girlywurly
Reviews.Content: I would rate this hotel five for everything (except location), except I have stayed there several times and it is not always consistent. One consistent quality is the cleanliness, on every one of my stays I have not been able to fault the cleanliness, either in the rooms or the public areas. The service is always at least very good, sometimes excellent. The check-in time is occasionally slow when busy, but the staff is always attentive and ready to assist and they are never impolite. I have stayed in various rooms at this Sheraton, from the standard rooms to the executive floor. Even the standard rooms are reasonably spacious, attractively furnished and usually everything works (if it doesn't, they fix it immediately). The beds are wonderful, so comfortable. A twin bedded room is two double sized beds, each with at least four pillows with extras in the wardrobe. Room service is, well ....room service! With fabulous food everywhere in Singapore, who wants room service? The breakfasts in their buffet restaurant are very Sheraton, very good, plenty of fresh fruit and excellent variety of cheeses and breads make the Continental b'fast good value. The soaring marble walls and the floor to ceiling glass overlooking the waterfall add a touch of the dramatic to this restaurant. Plenty of attentive staff members and everything looks good, crisp white cloths etc. The hotel has a very good outdoor pool - some rooms open directly to the pool area and there are also several luxurious individual cabanas in their own enclave just off the pool area - the cabanas do not have air conditioning. The location in Scotts Road may not suit some, being about a 10 minute walk to Orchard Road, but there is an MRT station right next to the hotel. I really like this hotel for its more restful atmosphere, more friendly than the usual five star hotels in Singapore. I also like the very excellent complimentary fitness centre where they will kit you out for the session if you have forgotten your gear. If you are a regular, they remember your birthday with a card and a cake!

Reviews.Title: “Old fashioned but nice service”
Reviews.Author: adzelme
Reviews.Content: I only choosed this hotel to keep earning spg points and only spg hotel available in Singapore at this moment. Defenitively it is not a 5 star hotel, a lot old fashioned. If you stay at business floor you can profit of business lounge and it's ok. Poor leisure facilities, no in-room movies, only cable tv. Service is great thou. Hotel is a 5 min walking distance to Newton Station, convenient sub station for red line. If you are looking for asian luxury or nice located hotel for bars and retaurants and shops... this is not the place.

Reviews.Title: “Forget it... there's better hotels with better value for money”
Reviews.Author: Lillyvalley
Reviews.Content: I've given this a poor rating because for the amount you pay for this hotel it's an absolute shambles!! Let's start with location, it's not bad.. on Scots road and a good 8 min walk to tube and the main shopping st. Staff, are poorly trained!!! we was staying there for a friends wedding... and on the wedding day, myself and my husband was suppose to travel with the family in the coach which was hired by the bride and groom. We explained this to the reception, that if a coach comes, pls ring us in our room. Instead we heard nothing and had to explain to the receptionist that we did asked someone there to ring us.. and in the end we just had to catch our own taxi!!! Luckily we made it to the church on time! - Staff was completely incompetent! I spoke to the bride and groom what had happened and they too was disgusted by the services as they too had warned the reception staff to contact everyone on the list who was suppose to be on the coach to the church. The room in the Sheraton is a reasonable size, but everything was so old and dingy looking.. the room was dark, though the bed was reasonably comfortable. All in all this was the worst hotel I stayed in Asia, especially the fact that it cost us £230Per night for a absolutely crap service and ugly room! breakfast was ok, nothing spectacular. I stayed here 2 nights for the wedding and had to get out and move to Orchard hotel which was much more modern, nicer and and better value.

Reviews.Title: “Forget it - don't be fooled by the Sheraton name!!”
Reviews.Author: JimmyinChina
Reviews.Content: I was shocked to see some of the reviewers here commenting that this hotel is great!!! (I did not mean to sound nasty to others but just trying to save others from staying there). As SPG Platinum member, I was TOTALLY and UTTERLY disappointed for what I got. I stayed there at the end of December with my friend and upon check-in, enquired the 10% discount which their Starwood Privilege Members (a F&B program) are entitled to. Though I knew it has to be mentioned upon making reservation, was I not entitled to open my mouth and asked?? The clerk treated me like a beggar and told me "You can only get discount in the Cafe Resaurant", and not for the rooms. Knowing very well its terms and conditions, I politely (I was more polite than him) asked him to check as it's not the money, it's the principles and entitlement) What's the big deal if I din't get it? He then reluctantly told me he would check and got back to me. A couple of hours later, I received an apology message and I was finally granted a discount of US19.00. I booked a twin room and therefore did not get any upgrade which I was entitled to (as Platinum member). That is fine as long as the room is nice and clean. To my horror, the room was smelly and extremely old-fashioned. It's more a room for the group tourists paying a US$40 rate!!! The twin beds are so tiny that I called it "grand baby cots" and I almost fell out of bed a few times. The filthy windows that faced the construction site opposite did not help to make me feel regrettable. The TV is so small you need a pair of binoculars to watch TV. I've never dreaded to go to bed when staying in a Starwood property but this hotel really succeeded!!! I will give them an award if they asked me to. I wrote to their Customer Service Center to tell them my experience (I was not even complaining) and told them I did not require a standard hotel response which would not have made up for a bad experience. But I did - I got a standard reply from their Front Office Manager apologizing and then ask me to "Let him know should I stay there again". He must be crazy - I would not even stay there again even if they give me a free room. All in all, the hotel was a total disaster (not the staff) and one felt being cheated, especially when paying US$190 for a night which is not considered as "cheap" or even reasonable. I'd rather pay another US$100 for a better deal. The staff at the Executive Lounge did not even offer to serve us drinks and we had to help ourselves. Perhaps we have Asian-looking face?? Whatever you do, DO NOT stay in this hotel unless you are an old-fashioned person and want to reminisce the good old days! A hostel is even better (although I have not stayed in one). If the location of this hotel is good, there are also many other choices too. Believe me, I was so glad to have moved to a much nicer hotel the next day. To be fair - at the same time - that's not much the hotel could do if whoever owns that hotel did not want to invest in a complete revonation. The other Starwood properties are all very nice. But, do us travellers a favour and justice - take down the Sheraton label from the exterior of the building, otherwise people will continue to fall into the Sheraton traps!! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay whilst in transit”
Reviews.Author: cosamlin
Reviews.Content: We have just been away traveling through Malaysia and Thailand for 2 weeks. We used this hotel for an overnight stay in transit. We found the room to be comfortable and the facilities to be everything that we required. We found that the hotel is aimed at the business customer but found the internet rates very high. Breakfast was a fantastic Buffet with everything that you could think of. The option of freshly squeezed juices was a bonus. The location is great to the MRT which is only a 2 minute walk out of the hotel. The staff and service were wonderful, we had one small incident that was rectified immediately as soon as mentioned. Overall this hotel was comfortable and met our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: varunjsharma
Reviews.Content: I found Sheraton Towers to be a good place for Business Meets and conferences. The rooms / architecture is quite old-world and is not half as modern as the Hyatt which is a few blocks away. The food is ok-ish, esp. for desis while the service is fantastic. I had a club room so had a great time, in the free-drinks hours in the evenings :)

Reviews.Title: “Musty damp smell !!!”
Reviews.Author: HKGJetsetter
Reviews.Content: This is a terrible hotel. The only thing going for it was the Location. They need to revamp the whole place and change the smelly carpets. Upon entering the Lobby all you can smell is the musty smell that runs throughout the hotel into the rooms. Shower was pathetic, lack of toiletries provided. Was very disappointed. Its too old and for the price you pay its definitely not value for money. I expect alot more from a Sheraton property.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaint...”
Reviews.Author: Saranghae
Reviews.Content: Big and luxurious lobby. The deluxe room is big enough and very comfortable. The bathroom is big enough and luxurious. This hotel is worthy to be called a 5 star hotel. The location is also very strategic because only take about 3 minutes to walk to Newton MRT station and bus stop. No complaint...just very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “a very convenient place”
Reviews.Author: paris-eric
Reviews.Content: After so many bad reviews on Tripadvisor, my partner and I were a little bit reluctant to stay at the Sheraton Singapore. We almost cancelled our booking. Eventually, we stayed three nights there and we have to admit that this is a good value for money place. First, it's very convenient, easily accessible from the airport, and very closed to a subway station (Newton). Then, if it's not the last fashionable crazy design boutique hotel you can see in many trendy magazines, this is a very confortable Sheraton hotel. Everything is very easy there. Rooms are OK, just what you need after a long trip from Europe. Ours was very quiet, facing the park on Scotts Road (rooms on the rear face a construction site that might be noisy). Not far from the hotel, there is a wonderful food hawker, with plenty of varieties of food, for a very affordable price. Just cross Scotts Road and go right before Newton Circus (5 min walk from the hotel)

Reviews.Title: “Dated, overpriced, what shall I say...”
Reviews.Author: KaiP
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in June 2008 for 4 nights. I have been to other fine hotels in Singapore, therefore I consider myself a bit spoiled... This hotel was truly a poor experience- the rooms are pretty dated, it smelled musty in the hallways as well as the room itself. Taking into account the pretty hefty price tag I would strongly recommend another place, unless you really need to stay in that location.

Reviews.Title: “Disappoints in Every Aspect”
Reviews.Author: jaejaez
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Towers Singapore (hereafter STS) is an aging property whose only chance of competing with its younger rivals is its level of service. Rooms are clean and serve their purpose but lacks in style and taste (a given for most hotels these days) with old TVs and plain furniture. The newly designed lobby is grandeur with marbles and smart lighting used to good effect, but still is unable to compete with the likes of the stylish Oriental or the magnificent Shangri-la (just to name two). The pool and the gym is also quite average and bland. The exterior of the hotel is the worst drawback, displaying a desperate need of a make-over. In all, the hotel is functional and will serve the basic needs but seriously lacks in tasteful touches. I once found a large, bulky and ugly looking air freshener placed right in front of the elevators in the hallway of my floor. Perhaps the ugliest sight I had ever seen from a (so-called) 5 star property. So what about service? I stayed here a few times and regret to say that the level of service has been poor every single time. The biggest flop was when I wanted to catch a taxi out at around 10:45PM and asked the doorman for help. To my shock, he showed resentment and told us that he was getting ready to go home as he finishes work at 11PM! Never before did I experience such nonsense. His tone of voice was also that of an uncle telling his nephew. In the end, I had to find my own cab – A revolting experience that I will never forget. Another mishap I experienced was when the check-in staff had no idea about the package I had booked. I once booked a romance-package that allows you a late checkout at 4 PM. When I was told that the check-out time was 12 PM, I enquired about my package but the staff had NO IDEA what I was talking about. After what felt like forever for her to search around her computer, I was told that the best she could do for me was a 2 PM check-out. Not wanting to spoil my romantic weekend, I forced myself to agree and went to my room. It was later that day when the front-desk called me to apologize and extended the check-out to 4 PM, which should have been the case from the very beginning. STS has to wake up and smell the coffee as Singapore is spoiled for good hotels with more in the pipeline. With no taste, poor service, only adequate amenities and doormen that scold guests for asking him to do his job, I would advise all to stay well clear. My only reason for having patronized Sheraton Towers Singapore was for it being one of the few Starwood properties in Singapore, but not even that will bring me back to this ugly building of disappointment ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Godfried
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 week beginning of July 2008. We stayed at the top floor. The hotel has got all it takes. Beautiful interior design, excellent service, conveniently located just beside the MRT station, at a short walk from Orchard Road and the Alliance Francaise. The breakfast buffet is as you would expect it in any upmarket hotel in Singapore: very copious, catering to all tastes and cultures. There are a few minor nuisances to mention: - The cornflakes at the breakfast buffet was quite flat and tasteless - The internet connection in the room is inconvenient - requires you to restart your computer several times before it works - and very expensive! - Don't go here for panoramic views: even from the top floor, all you see are cranes and construction sites. Then again, that's just Singapore I suppose.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: JamesVki
Reviews.Content: Yeah great hotel, i have stayed here many times while in Singapore, its not located in the best spot but not to far from Orchard Rd. The hotel is getting a bit dates of late but is still 4star and at the right price it really is a nice place to stay, Beds (most important) thing are really good, (not Sheraton sweet sleeper) but they are still very good. Buffet breakfast is wonderful, really is one of the best you get in hotels. Staff generally are well experienced and never had a problem with them or the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your earplugs”
Reviews.Author: flyboyden
Reviews.Content: Major construction project right next door. They work 0700-2100 and the noise is terrible. They do not tell you this at check in. If you need to sleep between 0700-2100 choose another location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: rakibey
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night on the 10th floor in a standard room. Reading some of the other reviews here, I was a bit worried as I am very picky, and a lot of reviews said it was very worn out. The reception, hall, restaurants etc are very fresh and nice, rooms are also nice. However, I agree that the wall to wall carpets could enjoy a make-over, but overall it seemed fresh and nice. Walking distance to Orchard Road. Appr. 4 Sin Dollar to Orchard Road by taxi. Breakfast buffet is also ok. I would rate it by singapore standards as a 4+ star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a bit dated but with excellent service and thats what matters”
Reviews.Author: Asiabugs
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights stopping over in Singapore on a trip to the Middle and Far East. The rooms and public areas are getting a bit dated and are no longer any comparison to some of the new or more recently upgraded properties. But what did impress us was the very friendly and attentive service we experienced everywhere in the hotel, right from the minute we entered through to breakfast and maid service. Tis certainly did make the difference. With the convenient MRT station across the street you are minutes from anywhere on the island and I can recommend this hotel to anyone looking fo a convenient and friendly spot, whether for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Abomination”
Reviews.Author: Platinum_Legion
Reviews.Content: Just checked in this morning. I've trusted the SPG brand for years ... I'm now looking for an alternative. Hotel rooms are 80s Sheraton Club floor is closed until April - maybe. Wired network in the room does not work (a wireless A/P is visible but not for use either) Cable came out of the handset of the phone when I tried to dial reception. When I arrived back at reception to report the problem with the phone I was asked why I hadn't telephoned down with the problem!!! Demolish it Starwood or get your name of the property!

Reviews.Title: “Good service but disappointing rooms”
Reviews.Author: ZMR
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a decent location, though not too convenient if you wish to be near Orchard Rd. The services was excellent. Staff most helpful and went out of their way for all request. The rooms were extremely disappointing. Old furniture and very dusty. Definatly not worth the price or the star rating in terms of general look. Neads an overhaul

Reviews.Title: “Time for an Extreme Makeover”
Reviews.Author: worldlyCanada
Reviews.Content: Somebody at Sheraton needs to be held accountable for attaching the Sheraton name to this property, which is so in need of an extreme make-over, it is laughable. There is a retro feel to this place that would seem even dated for the likes of Austin Powers, complete with faded carpeting, laminate doors to the rooms, and a frumpines that makes the Raffles Hotel appear cutting edge in comparison. Unfortunately, management have appeared to try the soft make-over approach by updating bits and pieces here and there when what they need to do is face the truth: the grand old lady has seen her days and it's time to close her down and renovate 'big time'. For what this hotel is charging, its not even on the same page as other hotels in itsleague.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shaymur
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located within a 10 minute walk of Orchard Road on Scotts Road. Check in and out was very efficient. The rooms are nice with a comfortable bed and good air conditioning though the hotel is a little old. Breakfast offers a good assortment of fruits, cereals, western and Asian style food but the seating area can be crowded during the week around 7:30 AM. An attendant dressed in white safari hat, white shorts, white shirt, white shoes, white socks and Sam Browne belt efficiently assists in catching a taxi. To catch an early flight, the attendant is also very helpful in scheduling a taxi for you. In rush hour, the hotel was about a 30 minute taxi ride from the airport, with minimal traffic the return trip was close to 20 minutes.
