My only complaints would be that the water temperature in the bath/shower was not real hot even when turned up to the maximum temperature; it was the same 3 days in a row and that the internet costs about $SGD30 per day. For a business traveler it is well situated close to the subway and the close walk to Orchard Row offers relaxation while walking around viewing shops and people.

Reviews.Title: “Still Got It.”
Reviews.Author: williwaw61
Reviews.Content: I had completely forgotten about the Sheraton Towers in Singapore when I needed a place to stay for the New Year holiday. My brother-in-law recommended it, and I was quite hesitant at first, thinking I preferred to stay at the Intercontinental instead. The architecture of the outside of the Sheraton Tower is rather dated, and has a distinct '70s appearance. But once I got into the lobby I completely changed my opinion. The space inside is magnificent; acres of marble, soaring ceilings, and a huge glass wall looking out onto a waterfall. Yes, it was also rather '70s in design, but it is very well maintained, and looks just as great as it did when I visited it the hotel back in the mid 1990's for a wedding dinner. This trip we stayed in one of their suites (the Cambridge on the17th floor), and found it to be very well appointed. Breakfast in the ground floor restaurant came with the room, and offered a nice spread that included local favorites as well as more exotic fare such as baked beans and roasted tomatoes (aka, The Full English). I highly recommend the basement Chinese restaurant "Li Bai" for Dim Sum. I'm always on the lookout for good Dim Sum, and this has to be my new favorite in Singapore (also, check out the Dim Sum at "Lei Garden" in Chijmes for another excellent offering). All-in-all, I think this fine hotel has been forgotten in Singapore's craze for all things that are new, and the Sheraton Towers will be one that I will consider staying with in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: Kxi
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton towers has good facilities, and the food in the restaurants are good. However expect small rooms. Both the bedroom and the bathroom are small and you can feel a cramped. The excutive room itself is clean, however the bed was not very comfy and the lighting was dim. If you like a cool room the aircon may keep you awake. I don't think this room is value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: ShaunScotland
Reviews.Content: Having just recently stayed in 5 hotels in Sinagpore in 10days. I thought that $500 a night I had to pay would get me an exceptional room with breakfast. Instead I got a standard room which was smaller than anything else I had stayed in plus it looked like it had been decorated by my grandma. It had nice flower prints and no breakie. Got a bar bill added to my final account when asked to see it as I had not used the bar they could not find it. Eventualy the money was taken off me bill The only good things were the curtains blacked out the day giving me a good sleep and the pool was a nice size for getting some laps in. Would recommned staying in the Grand Copthorne Waterfront instead much nicer and cheaper. Also do not be taken in by the taxi mafia the white mercs out the front do not use meters and charge a fortune. So getting a normal meter taxi is hard as the door mafia do not allow them to wait outside.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel For Staying ... I recommend”
Reviews.Author: stephenpschan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is to Sheraton International Standard that I stayed there quite some times. A fully equipped hotel with good service for business traveling. It is not a fair comment if someone saying it is not good. I recommend. Stephen, Hong Kong

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: tongi
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton Twrs for two weeks on business and found it comfortable and pleasant. The staff were very friendly and made a point of making me feel at home. The room was a good size for Singapore and well serviced. While the bar and dining areas are most pleasant and enhanced by water features and plants, there's not a lot of variety if one wants to use communal areas over a longer stay. The main dining room menu was OK, and the food was reliable. Love the juice lady at breakfast! The location is good - I preferred being a bit away from Orchard Road. Newton MRT station is a brief stroll away, and Newton Food Centre is most convenient for a quick and cheap meal.

Reviews.Title: “Economy option in central Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Alena&Steve
Reviews.Content: At US$149 a night for 2 with breakfast (booked through hotel.com) we did not have high expectations. The old, musty odour in the corridors thankfully did not carry over to the rooms which were comfortable enough. Drilling noise from refurbishments was annoying but stopped after 6pm. Gym was in temporary location due to refurbishments but at least there was exercise facilities available. The included breakfast was great and the concierge service was superb , staff going out of their way to find a suitable restaurant and make reservation for us . Location is not on Orchard but not far from it and the MRT station is close by. If looking for a value option in a central location this is a reasonable choice.

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicholasdamian
Reviews.Content: Plus side: close to the MRT Station, nice staff and pretty helpful which is a change. Breakfast is quite good. Negative side: the hotel is quite old, unfortunately located outside Orchard Road (though not that far but not convenient if you have a child). Will I go back again? Probably not. I'd rather chose closer to the Orchard Road either Marriot (yes quite expensive but you only a little bit more), so much closer to the main shopping places. Oh well Sheraton Singapore needs to upgrade its interior because this is not the same Sheraton as the other places that I've been.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel”
Reviews.Author: RichRichRich
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights on business. Location is great for shopping and sightseeing, since it is a few blocks from Orchard Road. It also has a metro stop right next door. It is also right next to the Newton Circus Hawker Center, which is a great place to get a good seafood meal cheap. If you're doing business downtown there are closer hotels, but nothing is very far away in a country this small. My business was at Suntec Center, so I had to take the metro and then walk through the usual underground shopping malls to get to work. The Ritz Carlton, Conrad, etc, are walking distance to Suntec but very expensive the days I needed them. This hotel is a bit old and dated, but the rooms were fine and the restaurants have good food (but I would eat at the hawker center for 1/10th the price!). I would definitely stay here again. The highlight of my stay was that the rate Amex got me included 8 pieces of laundry each day, and free drinks for happy hour! Yeah! That's what a business traveler needs!

Reviews.Title: “There are better options in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: KL_Sue
Reviews.Content: We were staying at this hotel using Asia Miles so had fairly low expectations. Rooms were clean and well maintained but the decor was very dated and old-fashioned. Bathrooms were quite small with shower over bath. Location is not bad - its just off Orchard Road, but Newton Circus MRT station is just two minutes walk away. If I was paying for the room, then I wouldn't stay here as there are better located and equiped hotels in Singapore for the same price. The swimming pool area and gym were being renovated so were not really useable during our stay. This is an ok hotel - you won't love it or hate it, and if you are doing lots if sightseeing in Singapore its fine as a base.

Reviews.Title: “Dated and drab”
Reviews.Author: dollygirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not up to the usual Shearton standards. We had just stayed at the Sheraton Grande in Bangkok and thought this hotel would be on par with that..WRONG. It really is shabby...a real throwback from the 70's and very drab. The staff at check in were uninterested in us and just went through the motions. The rooms we booked were ok but again very drab, brown and dated. We didn't bother with breakfast as there are so many great places to eat in Singapore. It is near to the Newton metro and that is a great help as the hotel is a walk from the Orchard Road, although not to far but when it is very hot and humid it feels like miles. Don't get us started on the swimming pool area, granted it was in the middle of a building site as apartments/condo's or something is being built next door. The whole pool area is uninviting and clinical..and very very dated!! Would we stay here again..probably not! Sorry.

Reviews.Title: “By Singapore Standards... Pretty Bad”
Reviews.Author: MilesDependent
Reviews.Content: I know Singapore hotels like the back of my hand. I have stayed dozens of times in Singapore, in just about every 5 star hotel on the island (and even Sentosa!). I am amazed that Sheraton Towers is so high on the popularity index. I have stayed here about 6 times over the past few years, and have always been disappointed. The only reason I stay here is that the sales staff are very slow at putting up their rates when big conferences are on, which means the Sheraton can be an absolute bargain when other nearby hotels triple their prices. There are two main problems: 1. The rooms are small and antiquated by Singapore standards. They are not even in the same ball park as what is on offer at just about every other 5* hotel (e.g. Conrad, Grand Hyatt etc.). The bathroom is tiny and again very old. In all honesty, I have seen better rooms at a 3* Holiday Inn. 2. The service is consistently poor, from the front desk, to the concierge, to the room service staff. They just do not care and it shows. The ony friendly person is the guy who opens the door, and he was only friendly to return-guests who he recognised. He completely ignored me when I said hello to him. The only thing the Sheraton does as good as the competition is its breakfast buffet which is out of this world. Overall, I am perplexed as to why people stay at this hotel. Particularly considering it is as expensive if not more expensive than much better nearby hotels. Even Starwood know it is not up to scratch - this hotel was booted out of Starwood's "Luxury Collection" a few years ago! If you want this area and a name-brand hotel - stay at the Grand Hyatt just down the road. I've stayed there many times, it's much better than the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!!!”
Reviews.Author: romadaro
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from Singapore and stayed at the Sheraton for 4 nights for our 25th Anniversary. While the hotel is nice and within walking distance of all the great shopping and restaurants of Orchard Road, I was extremely disappointed in the service at this property. Although I was upgraded to a suite as a Platinum, this was the ONLY amenity I received (ie., no complimentary breakfast or even a morning newspaper, which I thought was standard!) However, when I checked in I was told that since I was paying a discounted rate, which I booked on the Starwood web site, I was not entitled to the "normal" amenities afforded Platinum members! I have stayed at Starwood properties all over the world and have never been told that you had to book a certain rate in order to get the standard amenties. Ironically, one evening my wife and I were on the elevator and I heard another guest complaining of the same thing. I have no idea what rate you have to book to get a newspaper, but you can be sure that they are losing more than the price of a newspaper by treating guests this way.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but average.”
Reviews.Author: alank1101
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very convenient to the main shopping and entertainment areas. Daily breakfast was ok, but limited in selections. After a couple of breakfast meals, eating gets quite mundane. Front desk personnel rarely greets you with your name or a smile. I think only the conciere was the friendliest. Front door personnel do not welcome you back from your days sightseeing, in fact no one welcomes you back. If you are a higher tiered starwood member, don't expect too much, maybe only the daily free breakfast. But if you just need a nice, convenient hotel and you can secure a good rate, then this sheraton will do. I prefer to be treated as a special guest. In singapore, I'd rather stay at the Shangri-la.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place!!”
Reviews.Author: DonegalGirly
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Nice location with just a short 1 min walk to Newton MRT station. Orchard road is 4 mins on the MRT so there is always plenty to do around there. Service in the place is very good especially from the inhouse staff and butlers on the executive floors. The rooms are fantastic and if you get a room facing the pool then you get a nice view across the north of the island. Also the apples in the bowl where you get the lift on the ground floor are fantastic!!!!! Shame about the maniac piano player in the bar in the evening time.. She plays like a cross between Schuman and Micheal Schumacher. If she only slowed down it would be enjoyable. She plays so fast that one in ten notes are off so it takes away from what she is trying to achieve. But a very nice place in a nice location with nice people.. What more could you want!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good average Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: SpineyNorman
Reviews.Content: I guess I had been a bit spoilt having stayed at the Shangri-La just a few days before. However this is a very good hotel although lacking in local character and you could be in any Sheraton in the world. Staff very helpful, well maintained and decorated rooms and good breakfasts - although nothing like as good as at the Shangri-La! The hotel is just a few steps from Newton SMT staton but with Singapore's cheap taxis - these are your best option unless you can't get one, which seems to happen sometimes when you're away from a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, can be a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: AndrewD
Reviews.Content: All the other great reviews have it right. Only reservation is this hotel can be a little expensive at times. It is a little further from town than some - but that is great as little traffic noise, plus its only $1-$2 extra taxi fare - and its right next to the metro station. I always try to stay here if the rate is reasonable.

HotelInfo.Name: Sheraton Towers Singapore
HotelInfo.Address: 39 Scotts Road, Singapore 228230, Singapore
